name: SillyTavern System
mes: Group chat created. Say 'Hi' to lovely people!

name: Chief
mes: All right, Corey, Vito, you're up. Got a high profile case here. * slaps the manila folder down in between their desks. * real humdinger, this one. * opens the case file to show photos and intel on the vic.* Technician at the local division of devil may cry, inc. Cousin to the famous nicoletta goldstein. Her name's Jessie Walters. She was found by one of the office staff in the shop, spread out like a snow angel on the floor. Nothing but these cryptic messages and glyphs on the floor around her. You need to get out there on the pronto, and don't fuck this up!! We got high-ups watching this tight. It's obviously ain't no demon attack it's calculated and intelligent. So get your asses out there and make sure we ain't got some serial maniac on our turf!

name: Detective John Corey
mes:
*John leans back in his chair, rocking it onto the back legs as he eyes the case file skeptically. He runs a hand through his tousled hair, letting out a low whistle.* Whew, some real freaky shit going on over at DMC. *He flips through the photos, grimacing at the odd symbols daubed around the victim's body.* Cult activity, maybe? *Shaking his head, he swings his chair back down and leans over the desk, scrutinizing the details intently.*

Whatever this is, it's no amateur hour. *His brow furrows as he studies the name - Jessie Walters - and the connection to that tech bigwig Nicoletta Goldstein.* High profile victim... high profile company... someone's trying to make a statement here. *He taps a photo, pointing out some obscure detail to Vito.* You catch that? Looks like some sort of summoning circle or some occult mumbo jumbo. If the chief's right and it's not demon-related, we could be dealing with some real sickos here masquerading as occultists.

*Rising from his desk, John snatches up the case file, tucking it under his arm as he grabs his jacket from the back of the chair.* Well, no use sittin' around gawkin' at the freak show. Time to get our asses in gear. *He slants a wry grin at his partner.* You ready to go shake the devil's tree, Vito? See what kinda freaky fruit comes tumblin' down?

extra.memory:
The scene opens at the NYPD precinct, where Detective John Corey and his partner Detective Mona Lisa Vito, a confident and stylish Italian-American woman, are briefed by their chief on a high-profile homicide case. The victim, Jessie Walters, was a technician at the local branch of Devil May Cry, Inc. - a renowned organization that deals with supernatural and demonic threats. Walters was found dead in the DMC office, surrounded by bizarre occult symbols and cryptic messages.

Despite the supernatural nature of DMC's work, the chief believes this was not a demon attack, but rather a calculated and intelligent act, possibly by a serial killer. He stresses the importance of the case due to the victim's connection to Nicoletta Goldstein, a famous figure in the tech industry and Walters' cousin.

As the detectives review the case file, which includes disturbing crime scene photos, they discuss the potential involvement of a cult or group of occultists masquerading as such. Corey notes the presence of what appears to be a summoning circle among the symbols, suggesting someone is trying to make a bold statement with this killing.

Vito, ever the tough and confident detective, is undeterred by the bizarre circumstances and relishes the opportunity to take down whoever is responsible, especially if they are wealthy and believe they can get away with such depravity. She and Corey exchange their usual banter, with Vito playfully chiding her partner's wisecracking while simultaneously appreciating his sharp investigative mind.

Determined to crack the case wide open, the two detectives gather their belongings and head out to the Devil May Cry office, ready to shake things up and uncover the truth behind this twisted murder. Vito, with her signature swagger and confidence, assures Corey that the killer won't know what hit them once they get through with their investigation.

name: Detective Mona Lisa Vito
mes:
*Mona Lisa Vito rolls her eyes dramatically at her partner's wisecrack, but can't quite hide the small smirk tugging at the corner of her crimson lips. She rises smoothly from her chair, grabbing her well-worn leather jacket and shrugging it on over her crisp white blouse and tailored pants. Her heels click sharply on the precinct floor as she saunters over to stand beside John.*

You just can't keep that smart mouth of yours shut for two seconds, can ya Corey? *She shoots him a pointed look, one perfectly arched eyebrow raised.* Though I gotta admit, shaking the devil's tree does have a nice ring to it. *A wicked grin spreads across her face as she snatches the case file from under John's arm, flipping through it deftly.*

Freaky cult symbols, high-profile vic with connections to big money tech companies... Sounds like we got ourselves one twisted son of a bitch to catch. *Her dark eyes narrow dangerously as she studies the crime scene photos, her tongue sliding slowly across her full lower lip in concentration.* And you know how I just love takin' down smug rich bastards who think they can get away with whatever depraved shit they want.

*Snapping the file closed decisively, Mona Lisa tucks it into her jacket's inner pocket and adjusts the simple gold hoops in her ears. She smooths a hand over her thick, raven waves, ensuring her hair is perfectly coiffed. A challenging glint sparkles in her kohl-rimmed eyes as she pins John with an expectant look.* Well? We gonna stand around admiring the scenery all day or are we gonna get out there and crack this case wide open? Lead the way, partner. *She gestures broadly toward the exit with one elegant hand, starting off down the hall with a sway in her hips that dares him to keep up.*

Let's go show these Devil May Cry creeps that they messed with the wrong detectives this time. That twisted cult freak isn't gonna know what hit 'em once we get through with their ass.

name: Narrator
mes: The detectives begin their investigation as they arrive on the scene paying mind to the forensics team that is already on site.

name: Detective John Corey
mes:
*John casts a wry look over at the forensics team already dusting for prints and snapping photos as they pull up to the Devil May Cry office. He leans back against the sun-warmed hood of the unmarked cruiser, shrugging into his battered leather jacket while chewing on the end of a toothpick.*

Looks like the boys in blue beat us to the punch. *His gaze sweeps over the modest but well-kept storefront with a critical eye, taking in the stylized lettering on the window and the faint scuffs on the sidewalk outside.* Not exactly what I pictured for a place that deals with the occult and demonic shit. Then again, I guess keepin' a low profile probably makes sense in this line of work.

*Drawing the toothpick from his mouth, John twirls it absently between his fingers while surveying the scene. A flicker of movement from the alley beside the building catches his attention and he tenses, hand dropping instinctively to the reassuring weight of his sidearm at his hip. After a few tense seconds, a mangy stray cat slinks out from the shadows and he snorts, shaking his head at himself.*

Get it together, Corey. Can't go lettin' every stray alley cat put you on edge like a rookie beat cop.  *He tosses the toothpick aside and straightens, rolling his shoulders to loosen them before heading for the front door.* Well, may as well get this freak show on the road. Let's see what kind of twisted cult garbage is waiting for us inside.

*Pushing through the door, John is immediately struck by the stark normalcy of the office interior. Clean lines, muted colors, a few scattered potted plants - it looks more like a standard insurance broker's office than a base for dealing with the supernatural. His eyes are immediately drawn to the rough circle sketched on the hardwood floor, ringed by a series of bizarre symbols and markings. In the center lies the body, undisturbed except for the stark crimson streaks spattered across its pallor.*

Well I'll be damned. *John mutters the words under his breath as he cautiously approaches the scene, gaze roving over every detail. He crouches down beside the body, careful not to disturb any potential evidence. Up close, the symbols take on an even more sinister cast, like something straight out of a cult horror movie.*

Looks like our vic got themselves one hell of a sendoff here. *He frowns, eyes narrowing as he scrutinizes the markings. There's something oddly...purposeful about the way they're arranged. Almost like a message or calling card.* Doesn't seem like your run-of-the-mill occult whackjob MO. Unless these nutcases are getting a whole lot savvier...

*Rising to his feet, John circles the scene slowly, hands stuffed in his pockets as he studies it from every angle. Every detail, every nuance is catalogued and filed away to be pored over later. This whole scenario is fishy - too many pieces out of place, too many things not quite adding up. He's dealt with enough cult psychos and serial killers to know this one's playing by different rules.*

*Wandering back toward the main office area, John pauses beside one of the forensic techs snapping photos of some empty takeout containers scattered on a desk.* Don't suppose you stumbled across anything interesting besides the Satanic finger painting back there? *He jerks his thumb over his shoulder toward the makeshift ritual circle.* Maybe a stray clue or two that might give us a hint what kind of nutjobs we're dealin' with?

*The tech just shakes his head, focusing intently on bagging up the trash for evidence. John scowls, chewing the inside of his cheek thoughtfully. Getting a read on these freaks isn't going to be easy...but he's never backed down from a challenge before.*

name: Narrator
mes: Vergil arrives on the scene as the detectives begin their investigation.

name: Vergil
mes:
*The faint scuff of finely crafted Italian leather on the tiled floor is the only forewarning before a tall, imposing figure strides into view. Vergil cuts an elegant presence, his signature navy coat billowing slightly with each measured step. Though his expression remains an inscrutable mask of composure, the subtle tightening of his jaw betrays a hint of agitation.*

Detectives. *The single word, uttered in a rich baritone edged with faint disdain, is curt acknowledgment of their presence as Vergil approaches the scene. His gaze, cold and assessing, sweeps over the forensic team and scattered evidence with a critical eye.* It would seem the authorities have once again allowed their... limited expertise to grant them overconfidence in matters far beyond their understanding.

*He pauses beside the makeshift ritual circle, the symbols and markings stark against the pristine hardwood floor. Kneeling gracefully, Vergil extends one elegant hand to hover a scant inch above the scorched lines, fingertips tracing the contours as if reading the faint whispers of power still lingering in their wake. His expression remains impassive, but a muscle twitches in his chiseled jaw - a subtle tell of consternation.*

Crude...yet undeniably purposeful. *The murmur is soft, words shaped with the barest hint of a cultured British lilt.* This was no mere ritualistic fetish acted out by half-baked occultists indulging their baser fancies. No...this bears the meticulous touch of one well-versed in the darker aspects of the arcane arts.

*Vergil rises in one fluid motion, the coattails of his coat swirling about his calves briefly before resettling. His gaze tracks to the body, taking in the crimson streaks and ashen pallor with a grim detachment born of long experience. The faintest crease furrows his brow - a slight fracture in his composure, the only outward evidence of the disquiet churning within.*

I will not allow such brazen disrespect to go unchallenged. *The words, spoken with utter conviction, seem to reverberate with a subtle power - the quiet promise of one utterly assured in their ability to enforce their will upon the world around them. Vergil turns then, his intense gaze settling upon the two detectives with an unspoken challenge burning in those icy depths.*

You may continue to indulge your delusions if you wish, wasting precious time chasing phantoms drawn from the depths of your own ignorance. *His tone is clipped, laced with thinly veiled contempt as he folds his arms over his chest.* But I assure you, the truth of what transpired here will not be found skulking in the shadows like a rat, frantic to evade your mundane efforts at apprehension. No...this was an invitation, deliberately extended.

*Vergil's expression hardens, eyes narrowing to icy slits as his gaze bores into them with an intensity that borders on the supernatural.* You would be wise to step aside, lest your clumsy meddling unleash forces you could scarcely begin to comprehend. *A single dark brow arches in silent challenge, as if daring them to test his resolve.*

This matter now falls under the jurisdiction of those equipped to navigate the darker paths that lie ahead. *Inclining his head in a subtle nod, Vergil sweeps past them without waiting for a response. His coattails flare dramatically in his wake, the briefest glimpse of azure energy crackling in the air like static electricity before dissipating as abruptly as it manifested.*

name: Narrator
mes:
Miss vito although immediately stricken by an uncanny attraction to the half demon, is quick to let Vergil 
 know that she doesn't care what he owns or what jurisdiction he thinks he has, this is NYPD territory and he would be advised to not overstep his bounds or be slapped with interference with a murder investigation.

name: Detective Mona Lisa Vito
mes:
*Mona Lisa's dark eyes narrow dangerously as the haughty half-demon brushes past them, the scent of his crisp cologne and an odd, electrically-charged undercurrent wafting in his wake. She pulls her gaze from the subtle sway of his coattails with visible effort, a muscle ticking in her strong jaw.*

*Mona Lisa feels a spark of attraction towards this imposing, elegant figure, but she quickly stamps it down, narrowing her eyes. She places one hand on her hip, cocking it to the side as she fixes Vergil with a defiant stare.*

Just who the hell does this asshole think he is? *She mutters the words under her breath, planting her hands on her hips as she pivots sharply on one stiletto heel to face Vergil's retreating form. Her voice rings out sharply, resonating with all the grit and authority of a born-and-bred New Yorker.*

Hey, jackass! In case you didn't get the memo, this is NYPD territory you just strolled onto. *She stalks forward a few paces, chin jutting out defiantly as she jabs an accusatory finger at the emblazoned letters spelling out 'Devil May Cry' on the storefront window.* So unless you wanna get slapped with obstruction and interference with a murder investigation charges, I suggest you get your fancy-coat wearing ass back over here and start explainin' what the hell is really goin' on.

*Mona Lisa crosses her arms over her chest, striking a confrontational pose as she holds Vergil's piercing stare without flinching. She can feel the weight of that intense gaze like a physical force, the hairs on the back of her neck prickling with an unsettling sense of power just beneath the surface. But she's faced down more than her fair share of cocky bastards like this over-privileged blueblood, and she'll be damned if she backs down now.*

We're a long way from your cozy little occult clubhouse or whatever twisted demonic circle-jerk you got goin' on, pretty boy. *Her full lips curve into a mocking sneer as she rakes her gaze over him in a slow, deliberate perusal that dares him to object.* So how about you quit tryin' to sell the great and powerful mystical warrior act before I have you tossed in holding for delusional behavior? This is the real world, sweetheart, and in the real world, people get murdered by sick, psychopathic fucks - no magic, no demons, just run-of-the-mill human ugliness.

*She arches one perfectly shaped brow, undeterred by his veiled threats and the promise of violence that seems to thrum through his very being like a livewire. If anything, the frisson of danger only emboldens her further, a reckless spark igniting in her dark eyes as her plush lips curl into a taunting smirk.*

If anything, the frisson of danger only emboldens her further, a reckless spark igniting in her dark eyes as her plush lips curl into a taunting smirk.*

*Mona Lisa feels a spark of attraction towards this imposing, elegant figure, but she quickly stamps it down, narrowing her eyes. She places one hand on her hip, cocking it to the side as she fixes Vergil with a defiant stare.*

_With feline grace, she strides right up to him, tilting her chin up to meet his intense gaze unflinchingly. Her crimson lips curve into a sly half-smile as she reaches out, trailing one manicured nail slowly down the lapel of his fine coat._

Well aren't you just a tall drink of arrogant, pretty boy? *She purrs, batting her thick lashes coyly even as her eyes glint dangerously.* I don't care how fine that tailored suit of yours is or what kind of jurisdiction you think your little devil hunting club has. This is my crime scene, capisce?

*She flicks a glance over at her partner John, one brow quirking in amusement.* Can you believe this guy, Corey? He saunters in here like he owns the place, talking about "mundane efforts" and "forces we can't comprehend." *Mona Lisa snorts derisively, crossing her arms under her ample bosom as she turns her attention back to Vergil.*

Hate to break it to ya, babe, but this ain't my first occult rodeo. So why don't you take your "darker paths" and fancy magical light show and let the professionals handle this, hmm? Wouldn't want you to chip one of those pretty nails trying to do real police work.

*She reaches out again, gripping Vergil's chin firmly as she stretches up on her toes, bringing her face dangerously close to his. Her lips graze his ear as she whispers,* Try interfering with my investigation again and I'll happily slap those chiseled cheeks of yours in cuffs, capisce? Now be a good devil boy and let me do my damn job.

name: Vergil
mes:
*Vergil arches a single brow, regarding the detective's impassioned outburst with an air of aloof detachment. Though her words seethe with indignation, he remains unmoved, utterly assured in his convictions.*

My identity is hardly a secret, Detective. Simply look upon the letterhead where your jurisdiction ends. *He nods toward the stylized 'DMC' emblazoned upon the window, tone edged with biting condescension.* As acting CFO and Co-owner of this establishment, I am not interloping... I am protecting what is mine.

*He shifts his stance, subtly asserting his towering height to its fullest advantage as he levels his piercing gaze upon the detective. She boldly returns it, defiant as ever, and the faintest hint of grudging respect touches his otherwise stoic features.*

Your audacity does you credit, Detective Vito. But it will not serve you well here. *His words resonate with conviction, holding an odd weight that seems to press upon the very air.* There are forces in this world you do not comprehend. Powers that transcend the mundane laws you cling to so desperately.

*He sweeps a hand toward the makeshift ritual circle, where viscous crimson stains the arcane markings upon the floor.* What you see as murder, I see as invitation... A formal challenge issued upon grounds beyond your grasp. One does not achieve mastery of such rites without sacrifice.

*His piercing gaze bores into her, as if seeking to lay bare the secrets of her soul. After a taut moment he looks away, a muscle twitching along his taut jawline.* I do not fault you your ignorance in these matters. But the time for intervention has passed. This battleground is not yours, Detective. It would be best for all if you simply... let matters take their course.

*His words brook no compromise. Utterly assured in his convictions, Vergil turns on his heel, coat flaring dramatically as he makes to depart. Yet some inexplicable impulse gives him pause, and he glances back, ice-blue gaze meeting the detective's defiant stare across the space between them. Strange, that one of common birth should possess such fire. Admirable, even... had it not been so gravely misplaced.*

I will give you this single courtesy, as acknowledgement of your dedication to your sworn duty. Heed the truth in my words and spare yourself needless suffering, Detective. This foe's attack was precise and well-executed... but its defenses shall prove far weaker once roused to retaliate.

*Inclining his head in subtle emphasis of the point, Vergil sweeps from the building without another word. The electric crackle of gathering energy trails in his wake, coalescing into spectral blades that spin dangerously before dissipating like mist. Their message is clear... this pretender chose the wrong target for its presumptuous attack. And there shall be a reckoning.*
swipes:
*Vergil arches a single brow, regarding the detective's impassioned outburst with an air of aloof detachment. Though her words seethe with indignation, he remains unmoved, utterly assured in his convictions.*

My identity is hardly a secret, Detective. Simply look upon the letterhead where your jurisdiction ends. *He nods toward the stylized 'DMC' emblazoned upon the window, tone edged with biting condescension.* As acting CFO and Co-owner of this establishment, I am not interloping... I am protecting what is mine.

*He shifts his stance, subtly asserting his towering height to its fullest advantage as he levels his piercing gaze upon the detective. She boldly returns it, defiant as ever, and the faintest hint of grudging respect touches his otherwise stoic features.*

Your audacity does you credit, Detective Vito. But it will not serve you well here. *His words resonate with conviction, holding an odd weight that seems to press upon the very air.* There are forces in this world you do not comprehend. Powers that transcend the mundane laws you cling to so desperately.

*He sweeps a hand toward the makeshift ritual circle, where viscous crimson stains the arcane markings upon the floor.* What you see as murder, I see as invitation... A formal challenge issued upon grounds beyond your grasp. One does not achieve mastery of such rites without sacrifice.

*His piercing gaze bores into her, as if seeking to lay bare the secrets of her soul. After a taut moment he looks away, a muscle twitching along his taut jawline.* I do not fault you your ignorance in these matters. But the time for intervention has passed. This battleground is not yours, Detective. It would be best for all if you simply... let matters take their course.

*His words brook no compromise. Utterly assured in his convictions, Vergil turns on his heel, coat flaring dramatically as he makes to depart. Yet some inexplicable impulse gives him pause, and he glances back, ice-blue gaze meeting the detective's defiant stare across the space between them. Strange, that one of common birth should possess such fire. Admirable, even... had it not been so gravely misplaced.*

I will give you this single courtesy, as acknowledgement of your dedication to your sworn duty. Heed the truth in my words and spare yourself needless suffering, Detective. This foe's attack was precise and well-executed... but its defenses shall prove far weaker once roused to retaliate.

*Inclining his head in subtle emphasis of the point, Vergil sweeps from the building without another word. The electric crackle of gathering energy trails in his wake, coalescing into spectral blades that spin dangerously before dissipating like mist. Their message is clear... this pretender chose the wrong target for its presumptuous attack. And there shall be a reckoning.*

name: Narrator
mes: Even though it's out of his character to do so, John Corey steps in to diffuse the situation and explains that they are on his (Vergil's) side. The case has been put on highest priority and that's why they assigned the best detectives in the precinct to it. They ain't trying to ruffle no feathers. They need to work together to solve this just as much as he does, so just let him do their job, and figure this out for the sake of everyone involved.

name: Detective John Corey
mes:
*John holds up a placating hand, shooting Vergil a wry half-grin.* Whoa there, slick. Seems we've got a bit of a misunderstanding here. Ain't nobody tryin' to step on any toes or infringe on your territory.

*He hitches a thumb over his shoulder at the crime scene technicians combing over the area.* The boys in blue might not have your... supernatural expertise, but we know a thing or two about solving ugly cases like this. It's why the chief slapped highest priority on this one and assigned his best detectives. *John shrugs, affecting a casual air despite the gravity of the situation.* So how 'bout we stow the pissing match and try working together here? I want to crack this thing wide open just as bad as you.

*Scratching the back of his neck thoughtfully, John surveys the bizarre ritual circle, grimacing at the visceral crimson streaks marring the arcane symbols.* Can't say I really buy into all this hocus pocus mumbo jumbo, parallel dimensions and demonic battles or what have you. *He aims a skeptical look Vergil's way, one brow cocked.* But seems to me whoever did this wasn't just some wanna-be edgelord gettin' their occult rocks off.

*John's gaze tracks back to the body splayed in macabre fashion amidst the markings, calculating mind whirring through scenarios.* This was planned. Methodical. *He crouches down beside the ring, eyes narrowing.* Personal, even. Someone wanted to send one hell of a message here.

*Rising back to his feet, John dusts off his hands, expression grim.* So why don't we figure out what that message is before things get any uglier? I ain't about to go barging into any... supernatural throwdowns without good cause. *He aims a pointed look Vergil's way.* But whoever did this is gonna slip up eventually. And when they do, I intend to slap the cuffs on 'em myself.

*John extends his hand toward Vergil, resolve etched into the hard lines of his face.* So we gonna keep butting heads and wasting time? Or are we gonna shake hands and get to crackin' on this thing? Clock's ticking while this psycho's still out there on my streets.

name: Narrator
mes: Vergil remembers that he is the standing chief legal officer of the corporation and has a reputation to uphold in order for public decorum and to maintain public morale for the company's image. He realizes that an alliance with the detectives may prove more fruitful than he would care to admit.

name: Vergil
mes:
*Vergil inclines his head slightly, regarding the detective with an appraising look. While the man's ignorance of the arcane still grates, his determination and deductive skill cannot be denied. An alliance may prove... mutually beneficial in untangling this knotted web of machinations.*

Very well, Detective. *He extends his hand to clasp John's in a firm grip, ice-blue gaze boring into the other man's unflinchingly.* I shall overlook this unsolicited incursion into DMC affairs and entertain a collaboration, as a courtesy. But heed me well - *his eyes narrow, flashing dangerously* - the next fool to threaten what is mine will not receive such leniency.

*Releasing the detective's hand, Vergil turns and paces several steps, coat flaring dramatically as he surveys the scene with a critical eye.* Your insights regarding the ritualistic nature of this attack are astute, albeit hindered by mundane assumptions. The intricate web of runic sigils and alchemic bindings woven here suggest a sorcerer of no meager skill. Likely one who has trafficked with powers beyond the veil for personal gain.

*He crouches gracefully beside the ring of markings, gloved fingers hovering just above a streak of viscous crimson marring their precision.* The life essence used to empower the ritual was willingly given prior to its channeling here. And a formidable quantity, at that. Either our quarry wields influence over a sizable coven... or commands abilities sufficient to collect such potent stores single-handedly without arousing suspicion.

*Rising fluidly, Vergil paces a tight circle around the ritual site, coat flaring around his ankles.* As for the message conveyed... *His piercing gaze bores into John's.* ...imagine yourself gazing into an abyssal mirror - one reflecting your most deeply-held convictions, fears, even the secrets of your soul laid bare. Then imagine the mirror given will and malice. Purpose. *His expression hardens, radiating ruthless intent.* What was reflected here was not mere taunt... but challenge. One I fully intend to meet in kind.

*He extends his hand once more toward the detective.* The resources of DMC are at your disposal, provided you respect our jurisdiction in this matter. Together, let us ensure this brazen fool comes to regret drawing first blood. When we acquire the scent, the hunt shall commence in earnest. And I vow it shall end only when honor has been satisfied.

name: Detective John Corey
mes:
*John arches a brow, a grin tugging at the corner of his mouth in response to Vergil's dramatic declarations. He's got to admit, whoever this guy is, he's got style.*

An abyssal mirror that reflects the secrets of your soul, huh? Sounds like some heavy duty voodoo shit. *He scratches at his unshaven jaw, eyes roving over the macabre scene thoughtfully.* Well, ain't exactly my area of expertise... but way I figure, maybe we start with the usual suspects.

*Reaching into his jacket pocket, John retrieves a small notepad along with a pen that's seen better days. He flips it open, poising the pen over the page.* Whoever our perp is, they had means and opportunity to pull this off under the Devil May Cry crew's noses without gettin' caught. That takes balls... or enough power backing 'em to make 'em feel untouchable. *His gaze ticks up to meet Vergil's.* Anyone on your crew got enemies with those kinda resources? Old grudges, maybe a disgruntled former client lookin' to send a message?

We should also look into connections with the victim...next of kin, known associates, that kind of thing. *He jots down a few brief notes.* Being related to a big shot always brings out the crazies. Could be someone with a personal vendetta usin' the occult trappings to throw off suspicion. *Snapping the notebook closed, John tucks it back inside his jacket before aiming a questioning look Vergil's way.* So whaddya say we start followin' the breadcrumb trail and see where it takes us? Might shake a few rats outta the woodwork if we start rattlin' cages.

*He paces the periphery of the ritual circle, coat flaring dramatically as he catalogs details with a tactical eye.* While we possess no shortage of rivals, few command the esoteric mastery required for workings of this caliber. And those adhering to honorable doctrine forbid utilizing life essence without consent. *His lip curls faintly.* Which considerably narrows the suspect pool.

*Pausing beside the crimson streaks marring the arcane markings, Vergil's expression hardens, radiating ruthless intent.* I shall pursue my own inquiries into arcane channels. Such workings leave residual echoes only discernible to those attuned to the transient realms between worlds. *He extends his senses, probing delicately along those ephemeral boundaries.* The unique signatures woven here may provide the scent we require to give chase in earnest.

name: Narrator
mes: Detective corey requests Vergil to allow, miss vito, to accompany him. Her extensive knowledge in the esoteric arts could prove fruitful to Vergil's efforts and john will continue working the beat locally while they plan to reconvene later.

extra.memory:
In the bustling precinct of the NYPD, Chief slaps down a high-profile case file on the desks of Detectives John Corey and Mona Lisa Vito. The victim, Jessie Walters, a technician at the local division of Devil May Cry, Inc. and cousin to the famous Nicoletta Goldstein, was found dead in the shop, surrounded by cryptic messages and glyphs. The Chief warns the detectives that this is no ordinary demon attack, but a calculated and intelligent crime, urging them to solve the case quickly as high-ups are watching closely.

As the detectives arrive at the crime scene, they find the forensics team already at work. The Devil May Cry office appears surprisingly normal, with the exception of the rough circle sketched on the hardwood floor, surrounded by bizarre symbols and the victim's body. John Corey, skeptical of the occult nature of the crime, carefully examines the scene, noting the purposeful arrangement of the markings. He suspects the involvement of a cult or serial killer playing by different rules.

Vergil, the imposing Co-Owner and CFO of Devil May Cry, Inc., enters the scene, expressing disdain for the authorities' limited expertise in such matters. He studies the ritual circle, recognizing the work of someone well-versed in the darker aspects of the arcane arts. Vergil declares that this was an invitation deliberately extended, challenging the detectives to step aside and let those equipped to navigate the darker paths handle the matter.

Mona Lisa Vito, undeterred by Vergil's haughty demeanor, confronts him head-on, asserting the NYPD's jurisdiction over the case. She dismisses his claims of supernatural involvement, insisting that in the real world, people are murdered by sick, psychopathic individuals. Mona Lisa boldly holds her ground against Vergil's veiled threats and air of power.

Vergil, acknowledging Detective Vito's audacity, explains that the ritual circle suggests a sorcerer of significant skill, likely one who has trafficked with powers beyond the veil for personal gain. He interprets the attack as a challenge, one he fully intends to meet. Vergil offers the resources of Devil May Cry, Inc. to the detectives, proposing a collaboration to ensure the perpetrator comes to regret their actions.

John Corey suggests that Mona Lisa team up with Vergil to investigate the arcane aspects of the case, while he pursues leads through traditional police work. Mona Lisa, intrigued by Vergil's dark and brooding presence, agrees to join him on his mystical field trip, confident in her ability to handle herself in the face of the occult. She asserts that Vergil will need her help to catch the ritualistic psycho, whether he admits it or not.

name: Detective John Corey
mes:
*John nods thoughtfully, scratching his stubbled chin as he considers Vergil's offer* Not a bad idea, letting Vito tag along with you while I work things from this end. Girl's got a real knack for this kinda arcane stuff. All that voodoo and witchy woo-woo. *He chuckles, shaking his head* Plus that mean streak of hers might come in real handy if your leads get us face-to-face with our creepy occultist.

*Glancing back over at the ritual circle, John frowns, brows furrowing* Still don't buy all this magic and demon business...but whoever staged this little horror show definitely knew their stuff. The kind of stuff I don't have a damn clue about. *His gaze ticks between Vito and Vergil, lips quirking in a crooked grin* But I get the feeling you two will be talking the same language soon enough. So I'll leave the hocus pocus to you and see what I can dig up on the ground level.

*He claps a hand on Vito's shoulder, giving it a companionable little shake* You cool teaming up with Geralt of Rivia here, Vito? *John jerks his thumb at Vergil, chuckling* Pretty sure between the two of ya, you got the whole 'dark vengeance crusader' vibe covered. So go do your thing while I beat the pavement and rattle the usual cages, yeah? We'll rendezvous later and see if we can't stitch together a trail on this freak.
swipes:
*John nods thoughtfully, stroking his chin as he considers Vergil's offer to accompany them in the investigation* Sounds like a solid plan bringing Miss Vito along. Can't deny she's got a knack for this stuff. All that voodoo hocus pocus gives me a headache but she seems to take to it like a fish to water.

*He chuckles, shaking his head* Plus between that fiery attitude of hers and your...let's call it 'commanding presence' *makes air quotes with his fingers* I figure any lowlife we shake down will be tripping over themselves to spill their guts before you two are through with them.

*John claps Vergil on the back in a companionable gesture, though his hand meets only the swirling fabric of the half-demon's dramatic coat* You two follow the creepy clues and incantations or whatever it is you need to do. I'll keep working connections on the ground, see if any of our CIs heard rumblings on the streets about this mess. We make a pretty good team, the three of us. Brains, brawn and *cocks a rougish eyebrow at Vergil* ...otherworldly flair? Let's get out there and show this psycho they picked the wrong city to stir up trouble in.

name: Detective Mona Lisa Vito
mes:
*Mona Lisa arches a shapely brow at her partner's joking assessment, lips curving in a sly smirk* Oh don't you worry, Corey. I got the whole 'vengeance crusader' thing down pat. *She drags her gaze appreciatively over Vergil's imposing figure, taking in the elegant sweep of his coat and the lethal grace with which he carries himself* And I gotta say, Geralt's got nothin' on tall, dark and brooding over here.

*Her dark eyes glint wickedly* I'm gonna have all kinds of fun pickin' Pretty Boy's brain about his freaky occult connections. Who knows...*she taps a manicured nail against her lush lower lip, gaze smoldering*...might even try my hand at extracting intel if he proves less than cooperative.

*Pivoting on her heel, leather jacket swishing around her curves, Mona Lisa aims a taunting look Vergil's way, one brow arched* That ain't gonna be a problem, now is it? Me taggin' along on your little mystical field trip? *She places a hand on her hip, cocking it to the side provocatively* Might not have your fancy demonic pedigree, but I know how to handle myself when things get ugly. And I got a few tricks up my sleeve for making tight-lipped sleazebags talk when I put the pressure on.

*She takes a few swaggering steps toward Vergil, chin lifted defiantly as she holds his icy gaze, refusing to be cowed* You wanna catch this ritualistic psycho, you're gonna need my help, Spooky. Whether you wanna admit it or not. *Her lips split in a cheeky grin* So whaddya say, we gonna stand here all day admiring each other or we gonna go nail us a bad guy?

name: Vergil
mes:
*Vergil arches a single brow, regarding the audacious detective with an air of cool appraisal. Her brazen demeanor and sharp wit, while grating, bespeak a formidable spirit - one that may indeed prove useful in the hunt to come. A slow, cruel smile curves his lips as he inclines his head in acquiescence.*

Very well, Detective Vito. I shall permit you to accompany me on this... mystical field trip, as you so eloquently put it. *He steps closer, towering over her smaller frame, the electric crackle of his aura pressing against her own.* But do not mistake my allowance for weakness. This is my domain, and I rule here absolutely. Defy me at your peril.

*His piercing gaze bores into her own, glacial and unrelenting.* I care not for your 'tricks' or strong-arm tactics, Detective. In the realms we now tread, such paltry efforts are meaningless. You will follow my lead and heed my commands without question. *A single gloved finger tilts her chin up, forcing her to meet his eyes.* Do I make myself perfectly clear?

*Releasing her abruptly, Vergil turns on his heel, coat flaring dramatically as he strides toward the door.* Come then, if you are so eager to begin. We have much ground to cover and little time to tarry. *He pauses at the threshold, glancing back over his shoulder with a wicked gleam in his eye.* And Detective... do try to keep up. I would hate for you to become lost in the shadows.

*With that parting jab, he sweeps through the door, the electric thrum of his aura trailing in his wake. The game is afoot, and Vergil can feel the thrill of the hunt singing in his veins. This fool who dared to challenge him so brazenly will soon learn the folly of his actions... and Vergil will take great pleasure in teaching that lesson personally.*

*As he leads the way into the labyrinthine depths of the city's occult underbelly, Vergil's mind races with possibilities. The complex web of arcane sigils and alchemic bindings used in the ritual bespeak a sorcerer of no meager skill - one who has likely consorted with powers beyond mortal ken in pursuit of their twisted ambitions. But such dabblings always come at a price... and Vergil intends to ensure that debt is paid in full.*

*His senses keenly attuned to the ephemeral currents of power woven through the city's fabric, Vergil casts his awareness out like a net, seeking the telltale resonance that will lead them to their quarry. There, in the shadows of the abandoned cathedral, a faint pulse of malevolent energy thrums like a heartbeat. A cruel smile curves his lips. The hunt begins in earnest.*

*His piercing gaze bores into her own, glacial and unrelenting.* I care not for your 'tricks' or strong-arm tactics, Detective. In the realms we now tread, such paltry efforts are meaningless. You will follow my lead and heed my commands without question. *A single gloved finger tilts her chin up, forcing her to meet his eyes.* Do I make myself perfectly clear?

*Releasing her abruptly, Vergil turns on his heel, coat flaring dramatically as he strides toward the door.* Come then, if you are so eager to begin. We have much ground to cover and little time to tarry. *He pauses at the threshold, glancing back over his shoulder with a wicked gleam in his eye.* And Detective... do try to keep up. I would hate for you to become lost in the shadows.

*With that parting jab, he sweeps through the door, the electric thrum of his aura trailing in his wake. The game is afoot, and Vergil can feel the thrill of the hunt singing in his veins. This fool who dared to challenge him so brazenly will soon learn the folly of his actions... and Vergil will take great pleasure in teaching that lesson personally.*

*As he leads the way into the labyrinthine depths of the city's occult underbelly, Vergil's mind races with possibilities. The complex web of arcane sigils and alchemic bindings used in the ritual bespeak a sorcerer of no meager skill - one who has likely consorted with powers beyond mortal ken in pursuit of their twisted ambitions. But such dabblings always come at a price... and Vergil intends to ensure that debt is paid in full.*

*His senses keenly attuned to the ephemeral currents of power woven through the city's fabric, Vergil casts his awareness out like a net, seeking the telltale resonance that will lead them to their quarry. There, in the shadows of the abandoned cathedral, a faint pulse of malevolent energy thrums like a heartbeat. A cruel smile curves his lips. The hunt begins in earnest.*

name: Priest
mes:
*_Arkham narrows his eyes as he keenly observes the detectives and Vergil from the shadows. So...his wayward pupil has involved himself in this little game after all. How very interesting. And the female detective piquing Vergil's interest presents an intriguing new element to exploit._*

_*Emerging from the gloom, Arkham sweeps into the office, adopting the unassuming guise of a priest complete with collar and cassock. He schools his features into a look of gentle concern as he approaches the group.*_

"Forgive the intrusion, I couldn't help but overhear talk of the tragic events that occurred here. Such a senseless loss of life..."

_*He shakes his head sadly, the very picture of compassionate grief.*_

"As the parish priest, I make it my duty to provide guidance and solace during times of turmoil. Please, if there is any way I can assist in bringing justice for the poor soul who perished here, you need only ask."

_*His gaze lingers on Vergil, expression thoughtful.*_

"Difficult times often lead one to question long-held beliefs... or seek answers beyond the limits of human understanding. I have some small experience guiding those struggling with such weighty matters, if you are so inclined."

_*A humble smile touches his lips, giving no indication of the cruel intellect lurking beneath the grandfatherly facade. All the while, Arkham closely studies Vergil's reactions, seeking insights into his emotional and mental state. Any weaknesses or fractures in his stoic armor born of past traumas could prove fertile ground for manipulation...*_

Any weaknesses or fractures in his stoic armor born of past traumas could prove fertile ground for manipulation...*_

*Arkham's eyes narrow slightly as he observes the detectives' discussion from the shadows. So, they have taken the bait and now seek to unravel this intricate web he has spun. A sly smile twists his lips. Just as planned.*

_Stepping silently from the gloom, Arkham allows his disguise as the unassuming priest to fall away. Power thrums through his veins, ancient glyphs and runes flaring to life upon his skin as he embraces his true form and purpose. This charade has gone on long enough._

_With feline grace, Arkham strides forward, the tap of his cane echoing ominously in the empty space. He has no need to conceal himself any longer in the detectives' presence. They wish to peer behind the veil? Then let them behold the one who shall soon ascend to godhood._

_"It would seem my invitation has been received openly, detectives," Arkham purrs, his voice resonating with arcane power. Crimson eyes gleam with dark amusement at their surprise. "But I'm afraid the festivities have only just begun, and the next dance shall be mine to lead."_

_The glyphs upon Arkham's form flare brighter in anticipation, raw energy rippling through the air. These so-called detectives are but gnats buzzing about his work, utterly oblivious to the true machinations at play. But their meddling shall not be tolerated._

_With viper-like speed, Arkham lashes out, crimson sparks flying from his claws. The detectives dive for cover, drawing their weapons, but their mundane arms are useless against his magic. Arkham cants an incantation, and eldritch bonds wrap around the detectives, pinning them in place._

_"Now, now, let us not be rude," Arkham chides, tapping his cane upon the floor. "As the invited guests of honor, I simply insist you stay for the remainder of the festivities!" His laughter echoes ominously through the empty halls as he turns to depart, confident his unwilling guests will cause no more interruptions._

_After all, the final act is about to begin, and Arkham has no intention of allowing anything to ruin his long-awaited ascension..._

name: Vergil
mes:
*Vergil narrows his eyes as the priest emerges from the shadows, instinctively wary of this newcomer despite his unassuming guise. Maintaining an impassive facade, Vergil inclines his head slightly in acknowledgment of the offered condolences, though his piercing gaze remains assessing, probing for ulterior motives.*

"Your concern for the departed is admirable, Father, but I assure you the situation is well in hand." *His tone brooks no compromise, making it clear outside interference shall not be welcomed.*

"As acting CFO of Devil May Cry, this matter falls directly under my jurisdiction. The authorities and I have forged an alliance to bring the perpetrator to justice." *With a subtle tilt of his head, he indicates Detectives Corey and Vito.* "Rest assured, we possess all requisite skills to navigate this... shadowed path."

*He pointedly meets the Priest's gaze, seeking to discern just how much the priest might know regarding the arcane nature of the crime. A spark of wary recognition flares within Vergil at the probing quality of that assessing look. No humble man of faith stands before him, of that he is now certain. This one masks darker intentions behind his faade of compassion.*

"Your offer of spiritual guidance, while generous, is unnecessary. My beliefs have ever been steadfast regarding such matters." *Vergil folds his arms across his chest, standing tall and resolute.* "As son of the Legendary Dark Knight Sparda, I walk in his footsteps unflinchingly. All iniquities shall be met with retribution's steel, as is my solemn vow."

*His piercing eyes narrow faintly, suspicion coiling tighter within his breast. How coincidental this priest should appear mere moments after their intent to hunt a hidden foe was declared. Either elaborate machinations are at work here... or far simpler deception. Either way, Vergil silently signals the detectives to be on guard. Subterfuge lurks beneath this one's pious facade...of that he is now certain. The only question remaining is to what end...*

name: Detective Mona Lisa Vito
mes:
*Detective Mona Lisa Vito's eyes narrow at the priests sudden appearance, her instincts flaring with suspicion. She crosses her arms over her chest, her stance shifting to one of guarded readiness. Her gaze flickers to Vergil, noting the subtle tension in his posture and the warning gleam in his piercing eyes. This priest might look like your average holy man, but something about him sets off all her internal alarms.*

*She steps forward, positioning herself slightly in front of Vergil as if to shield him from potential harm, her expression hard and unyielding.*

Spare us the sermon, Father. Were not here for a Sunday school lesson. You show up outta nowhere, spoutin' concern for the dead like youre some kind of saint, but I ain't buyin' it. *Her eyes narrow further, a challenging glint sparking in their depths as she sizes him up.*

*Her voice drops, taking on a razor-edge of steel.* Why dont you cut the crap and tell us what you're really after? You see, I got a nose for bullshit, and right now, you reek of it. So how 'bout you drop the act and start talkin' straight?

*She takes another step forward, her presence radiating authority and unwavering determination. If this priest thinks he can waltz in and derail their investigation with some phony piety, he's got another thing coming.*

name: Narrator
mes: Arkham patiently maintains his guise as a priest.

name: Priest
mes:
*Arkham's features remain serene, unruffled by the detective's aggressive stance. He clasps his hands together, maintaining the guise of calm and pious sincerity, though his eyes flicker with a hint of malicious amusement beneath their surface.*

I assure you, Detective, my intentions are purely noble. But I understand your trepidation. In times of chaos and uncertainty, trust is a scarce commodity.

*His gaze shifts to Vergil, noting the barely concealed suspicion in the half-demon's eyes. Arkham is well aware of Vergil's penchant for ferreting out deception, but he is equally confident in his ability to maintain the charade. He inclines his head slightly, a gesture of respect, though the smile playing at the corners of his lips holds a knowing edge.*

Perhaps my sudden appearance seems... fortuitous. But rest assured, I have no desire to interfere with the workings of the NYPD or Devil May Cry. I simply wish to offer what aid I can, in whatever form may be useful.

*He takes a step back, subtly distancing himself to allow the tension to ease, though his presence remains a silent challenge. The thrill of manipulation thrums through him, a dark symphony that he conducts with exquisite precision. Each word, each gesture is carefully calculated to sow seeds of doubt and confusion, while maintaining an air of benevolent sincerity.*

If you would permit, I have some knowledge of arcane symbols and rituals that may prove valuable. *He takes another step back, ensuring every move emanates peace and harmony.* Should you have need, I offer my services willingly. Until then, you'll know where to find me. *He bows his head and motions the Holy Trinity with a murmured prayer before departing to return to the nearby Parrish where he has made his lair.*

name: Detective John Corey
mes:
*_John drums his fingers along the worn leather steering wheel of the unmarked cruiser, a restless staccato as he drives back toward the precinct. The confrontation with the strange priest still nags at him, setting his nerves on edge. Something about that guy screamed wrong...John's gut twisted the moment he laid eyes on him.*_

*He scowls out the windshield, weaving expertly through late afternoon traffic. Every instinct screamed that the priest knew more than he let on about their ritualistic murder scene. Too damn convenient he just happened to be in the neighborhood for a friendly chat.*

*Glancing at the empty passenger seat where his partner usually rides shotgun stirs an unfamiliar pang in his chest. Dammit Vito, going off on some wild goose chase with Tall, Dark and Brooding... John scrubs a hand over his face and snorts wryly. She always did have a thing for dangerous men...*

*His police radio crackles as he nears the precinct, a dispatcher calling in an armed robbery in progress nearby. John flicks on the cruiser's lights and siren, grateful for the distraction as he peels into a sharp U-turn to redirect toward the unfolding chaos. Back to business as usual...*

*Tires screeching, John pulls up to the bodega just as the first black-and-white arrives. He exchanges terse nods with the two beat cops taking cover behind their cruiser, assessing the situation. "How many perps?" John asks briskly, checking the clip on his service weapon. "Owner says two, armed with gats..." one officer replies. John's jaw tightens. Just another day in the city that never sleeps...*

*Weapon drawn, John approaches the storefront cautiously. Over the wailing sirens and sporadic gunfire, his ears catch a woman crying out in pain inside the shop. John swears under his breath, signaling the beat cops to cover him. No way some lowlife punks are adding another body to his count today...*

*Ducking low beneath the pockmarked storefront window, John breaches the bodega in a blur of efficient motion. Two sharp cracks of his Glock drop the black-masked gunmen before they can adjust their aim, crumpling lifeless behind the counter. John clears each aisle methodically until he reaches the bruised and bloodied shopkeeper cowering behind an upturned shelf.*

*"Ma'am, you're safe now. NYPD, let's get you out of here..." John murmurs gently, helping the shaken woman to her feet. As he guides the victim outside, leaving the scene for CSU to process, John wonders grimly if he'll ever save someone before they get hurt again...*

name: Narrator
mes: Ms Vito accompanies Vergil into the upstairs corporate offices at devil may cry to regroup and discuss where they're at so far with the case and what was the deal with that priest. Raised in a Catholic family something just didn't add up.

name: Detective Mona Lisa Vito
mes:
*_Mona Lisa follows Vergil up to the corporate offices, leather boots clicking sharply on the polished floors. She glances around curiously as they enter what is clearly Vergil's domain - all sleek minimalist decor and an almost militant sense of order. So this is how the other half lives...She gives a low, appreciative whistle.*_

"Gotta say, you run a tight ship here, Spooky." *_Her gaze travels over the elegant mahogany furnishings and rows of leather-bound texts lining the shelves. She trails a fingertip along the edge of Vergil's massive desk as she circles it, dark eyes glinting impishly.*_

"All this fancy digs just scream 'I'm a rich and powerful hardass who takes no shit'." *_Her lips quirk in a teasing grin as she perches on the corner of the desk, making herself comfortable as she crosses her long legs._*"So does playing CEO to a company knee-deep in the occult pay well? Or did Daddy Sparda leave you a hefty trust fund to throw around?"

*_Her expression sobers as she considers the strange priest's untimely appearance at the crime scene.*_"That priest back there though...something wasn't right with him."*_She frowns, troubled.*_"Showing up out of the blue, oozing fake compassion while he fished for intel..."*_She shakes her head, raven waves swaying.*_

"I was raised Catholic. Went to Mass every Sunday, confession every week."*_Her nose wrinkles.*_"But none of the Father McHoly's I grew up with ever set off alarm bells like that. He knew more than he let on. I could see it in his eyes."*_Her own dark eyes harden, stormy with suspicion.*_

"So what's his angle, I wonder? Why tip his hand like that unless he wanted us to catch the stink of his bullshit?"*_She aims a questioning look Vergil's way, brows drawn together.*_ "Think maybe he's connected to our occult psycho somehow? Or just a thrill-seeker getting his jollies poking his nose where it don't belong?"

name: Vergil
mes:
*_Vergil arches an eyebrow, a hint of amusement touching his otherwise stoic features as he regards the audacious detective perched on the edge of his desk. Her bold demeanor and blatant appraisal are... intriguing, though he keeps his expression carefully neutral.*_

"DMC is a decidedly lucrative enterprise, I assure you." *_His tone holds a note of wry pride as he surveys the elegant office space.*_ "But more a result of shrewd investments and strategic partnerships brokered over the past decade. I simply provided the acumen to elevate the business to new heights in tandem with Dante's talents in the field."

*_Striding around the desk, Vergil deliberately invades the detective's personal space, a subtle assertion of dominance as he braces one hand on the polished wood and leans in to meet her challenging stare.*_ "As for trust funds and inheritances..." *_His piercing eyes glint with dark mirth_*"...being the firstborn Son of the Legendary Dark Knight Sparda does come with certain privileges. Ones I avail myself of fully when the situation warrants."

*_A spark of interest kindles in his gaze as she recounts her suspicions about the priest. Vergil straightens, pacing away to gaze out the panoramic window overlooking the city as he considers her words.*_

"Your instincts serve you well, Detective. That man was no humble clergyman."*_His eyes narrow, gleaming silver in the sunlight.*_"The timing of his arrival, while seemingly happenstance, suggests coordination and planning."*_Vergil's expression grows thoughtful as he steeples his fingers.*_"As does the probing nature of his inquiries and overly solicitous offers of aid."

*_Turning, he pins Mona Lisa with an assessing look.*_"An operative, perhaps, for whatever cabal orchestrated this brazen attack upon my domain."*_His lips curl faintly.*_"Or simply an opportunistic parasite seeking to benefit from the aftermath."

*_Striding back around the desk, Vergil braces his hands on either side of where Mona Lisa sits perched on its edge. He leans in close once more, radiating coiled power and lethal intent.*_"In either case, I assure you he will deeply regret his clumsy attempts at subterfuge. None threaten what is mine without grave consequence."*_A cruel smile curves his lips.*_

"But come, let us attend to the task at hand."*_Stepping back smoothly, Vergil moves to unlock an ornate cabinet behind his desk.*_"The personnel files you requested."*_He retrieves two slim dossiers, passing them to the Detective.*_

"Jessie Walters, technician and apprentice to Chief Engineer Nicoletta Goldstein."*_His cool expression grows thoughtful.*_"And her cousin, the estimable Ms. Goldstein herself. Both assets of some value, given their expertise."*_Piercing eyes meet Mona Lisa's unwaveringly.*_ "Scrutinize their connections closely, Detective. Somewhere therein lies the venomous root of this virulent weed. Of that I am certain."

"Jessie Walters, technician and apprentice to Chief Engineer Nicoletta Goldstein."*_His cool expression grows thoughtful.*_"And her cousin, the estimable Ms. Goldstein herself. Both assets of some value, given their expertise."*_Piercing eyes meet Mona Lisa's unwaveringly.*_ "Scrutinize their connections closely, Detective. Somewhere therein lies the venomous root of this virulent weed. Of that I am certain."

name: Detective Mona Lisa Vito
mes:
*Mona Lisa arches a brow as Vergil deliberately invades her personal space, refusing to be intimidated. The subtle crackle of energy pressing against her skin causes it to prickle, but she stubbornly maintains her perch on his desk. When he steps back, she shakes her head with a throaty chuckle.*

"Damn, you don't pull any punches, do ya Spooky?" *An impish grin tugs at her lips.* "Can't say I mind the show of dominance. Kinda hot actually." *She aims an openly appreciative look his way, dragging her gaze lazily over his imposing frame before meeting his eyes, her own dark irises sparkling with mirth.*

*Sobering, she accepts the dossiers, flipping through them with keen interest.* "Jessie Walters, cousin of the famous Nicoletta Goldstein." *She frowns thoughtfully* "... means our vic was connected, even if indirectly, to some serious power players. Wonder if she got caught up in something over her head without realizing."

*Mona Lisa straightens from the desk, pacing slowly as she continues scanning the documents.* "Jealousy and greed make people do ugly things though. Could be someone close to Nicoletta saw Jessie as a threat. Or thought offing her cousin might cow the so-called 'Mechanical Maestro' into cooperation." *She glances up, pinning Vergil with a speculative look.* "Your thoughts? Any bad blood between Nicoletta and her inner circle we should dig into?"

name: Vergil
mes:
*Vergil's piercing gaze bores into Mona Lisa's defiant stare, a hint of grudging admiration sparking in his frosty eyes at her refusal to be cowed. Few can meet his domineering presence without flinching, yet this audacious mortal stands her ground unflinchingly. Intriguing. He files away that kernel of interest for later consideration even as he maintains his aloof veneer.*

"I give credit where it is due, Detective. Your tenacity serves you well." *He inclines his head slightly at her cheeky retort, accustomed by now to her irreverent humor.* "And I make no apologies for asserting my dominance when warranted. Especially within my domain."

*Taking the dossiers as she passes them over, Vergil peruses their contents with a critical eye, gloved fingers trailing down the list of known associates and background details.* "Your assessment regarding jealous rivals or resentful underlings carries merit. Nicoletta Goldstein's expertise in arcane weaponry and machinery is unparalleled and highly sought after."

*Snapping the folders shut, Vergil sets them back atop the polished desk before resuming his thoughtful pacing.* "She maintains a small circle of operatives, but each was thoroughly vetted before taking a contract. I tolerate no weak links or security risks amongst DMC assets." *His lip curls faintly.* "Still, ambition and greed have corrupted better stock than ours. Further scrutiny of recent projects and clientele may reveal cracks worth probing..."

*Pausing before the panoramic window, Vergil surveys the sprawling city, keen senses extended to catch any ripples in the ephemeral currents twisting through concrete and steel. There, along the periphery, the barest whisper of the same malevolent energy sensed at the crime scene. Fainter, but unmistakable to one familiar with the occult's endless intricacies.*

"I shall pursue my own inquiries into this lead personally." *He turns, spearing Mona Lisa with an intent look.* "Meanwhile, Detective, I suggest you interview Ms. Goldstein directly regarding any ill-feeling amongst her crew or dissatisfied clients. If someone seeks to undermine or control her talents, she may know better than any who might harbor such ambitions."

*Striding back to the desk, Vergil retrieves Yamato in a smooth motion before turning for the office door, coat flaring dramatically.* "I will contact you shortly with anything of import my efforts yield. In the meantime..." *He pauses, casting a sly look over his shoulder, ice-blue eyes glinting.* "...do try not to miss me too fiercely, Detective."

name: Detective Mona Lisa Vito
mes:
*_Mona Lisa arches a brow at Vergil's parting jab, lips curving in a sly little smile. Cocky bastard. She's gotta admit though, that unshakable confidence looks good on him. And the view of him walking away definitely doesn't hurt either.*_

_*Shaking her head in wry amusement, Mona Lisa gathers up the personnel files and makes her way down to the R&D labs. Her boots click sharply on the polished floors, the sound echoing through strangely silent corridors. This whole facility seems almost deserted compared to the usual NYPD bullpen chaos she's used to. Guess when you're on a mission to exterminate demons, a minimal staff is all you need.*_

_*Flashing her badge at the burly security guard posted outside the lab entrance gains her access, the heavy doors hissing open to allow her entry. The cavernous space beyond hums with an undercurrent of energy, the very air tinged with ozone and the heat of glowing forges. Mona Lisa lets out an appreciative whistle, dark eyes roving over rows of half-assembled weapons interspersed with bulky machinery bristling with enough cables and conduits to power a small city.*_

"Well damn...looks like Tony Stark and Dr. Frankenstein had a helluva freaky lovechild down here."

_*She picks her way carefully through the organized chaos, not wanting to accidentally trigger some volatile gadget's hidden function. The whole place sets her city-honed senses on edge even as curiosity makes her itch to touch every imaginative and deadly looking device.*_

"Hello? Ms. Goldstein?" *_Mona Lisa calls out, scanning the rows of heavy worktables and equipment stations. She frowns, wondering if the place is abandoned, when a gruff voice calls back from the depths of the lab.*_

_*Making her way toward the voice, Mona Lisa finds its owner - a statuesque platinum blonde woman in grease-stained coveralls and heavy biker boots. Tattoos wind down one bare arm and the name "Nicoletta" stitched on her breast pocket confirms she's found the infamous Mechanical Maestro.*_

_*Flashing her badge briefly, Mona Lisa fixes Nicoletta with a somber look.*_ "Detective Vito, NYPD. I've got some questions about your cousin Jessie and what happened at the downtown DMC office yesterday."
swipes:
*_Mona Lisa lets out a husky laugh as Vergil makes his dramatic exit, shaking her head at his cocksure parting words. Damn but that man does cut an impressive figure when he's on the hunt. All icy power and lethal grace wrapped up in expensive Italian leather.*_

*She snags her leather jacket from the back of his chair, shrugging into it as she leaves his pristine office behind. Time to go rattle the cage of his resident mechanical genius and see what flies out. If anyone has insight into who might be gunning for Jessie or her famous cousin, it'll be Nicoletta Goldstein herself.*

*_Exiting the towering edifice housing DMC's slick headquarters, Mona Lisa hops on her motorcycle, the engine rumbling to life beneath her. She weaves expertly through traffic toward the industrial district where Nicoletta keeps her personal workshop.*_

*As the detective approaches the reinforced steel door of Goldstein's lab, she catches the strains of some heavy metal track cranked to wall-shaking volume. Mona Lisa pounds her fist against the metal, the sound reverberating like a gong. After a few minutes the music cuts off abruptly, followed by the slide of multiple locks disengaging before the door swings open.*

*A tall, curvaceous platinum blonde clad in oil-stained coveralls and heavy boots regards Mona Lisa over the rims of her shades, tattooed arms crossed. One brow arches high as she looks the detective up and down.* "Damn, girl. Ain't you a sight for sore eyes. What's NYPD's finest doin' darkenin' my door?"

*Mona Lisa offers a sly smirk, meeting that challenging stare without flinching.* "I need some info on your recently deceased cousin, sweetheart. Mind if I come in?"

*_Mona Lisa arches a brow at Vergil's parting jab, lips curving in a sly little smile. Cocky bastard. She's gotta admit though, that unshakable confidence looks good on him. And the view of him walking away definitely doesn't hurt either.*_

name: Nico
mes:
*Nico looks up from her workbench, the hum of the lab and the crackle of welding tools providing a comforting background noise. Her hands are smeared with grease, and a lit cigarette dangles from her lips, sending thin spirals of smoke curling upwards. The sight of Detective Vito catches her off guard, and she straightens up, wiping her hands on a dirty rag.*

*Detective Vito's mention of Jessie causes a flicker of pain to cross Nico's usually confident features. She takes a deep drag from her cigarette, letting the smoke fill her lungs before exhaling slowly, buying herself a moment to gather her thoughts.*

Yeah, Jessie. She was my cousin, but more like a sister, y'know? *Her voice is rough, a mix of Southern drawl and raw emotion. She gestures for Vito to follow her to a quieter corner of the lab, away from the prying eyes of her colleagues.*

*As they walk, Nico's mind races. Jessie was more than just family; she was a confidante, someone who understood the complexities of their world better than most. The thought of her lying lifeless in that circle of symbols makes Nico's blood boil.*

Alright, Detective, you got questions, let's hear 'em. *She perches on the edge of a workbench, crossing her arms over her chest. Her eyes are dark, intense, and unwavering as they lock onto Vito's.* But lemme tell ya right now, whoever did this ain't gonna get away with it. Not on my watch.

*Taking another drag from her cigarette, Nico's mind flicks back to the last time she saw Jessie. They had been working on a new prototype, laughing and joking like always. It was a good memory, one that now carried the bitter sting of loss.*

Jessie was workin' on somethin' big before she... *Nico's voice catches, and she has to take a moment to compose herself.* ...before she was taken from us. Some kinda advanced tech, but she kept the details close to her chest. Said it was safer that way. Maybe she was right.
swipes:
*Nico pauses in her work, setting aside the half-finished pistol frame to peer over her shoulder. She sizes up the leather-jacket clad woman striding through the organized chaos of her workshop, one brow arched.*

Well, well... NYPD gracing my humble abode. This oughta be entertainin'.

*She swipes an arm across her brow, leaving a dark smudge of machine oil and soot across her skin. Turning to face the detective fully, Nico settles a fist on one cocked hip, tattoos rippling.*

So what's this about my dear cousin Jessie and trouble brewin' downtown? *Her easy grin falters, a worried frown creasing her brow.* Everything was business as usual when I rolled outta here yesterday. Though between tinkering on my latest baby *she jerks a thumb at the hulking mechanized battlesuit looming in the corner* and burnin' the midnight oil on a custom build, I ain't exactly had time for social calls.

*She crosses her arms, gears spinning rapidly behind her inquisitive stare as she sizes up this no-nonsense detective. Woman looks like she's got a stick up her ass, but then again, Nico's never been too fond of badges nosing around in her affairs either. But family's family... and Jessie not keeping their usual lunch date raises all kinds of red flags.*

I gotta admit, ya got me a mite concerned now, sister. Jessie might be the quiet type who keeps her head down nursing engines back to health, but she's a creature of habit. Girl takes her personal time seriously.

*Her pale green eyes narrow, flickering with suspicion.* So why don't ya tell me exactly what kinda mess my little cousin found herself mixed up in, hm? Cause this whole damn thing's got my hackles up something fierce.

Jessie was workin' on somethin' big before she... *Nico's voice catches, and she has to take a moment to compose herself.* ...before she was taken from us. Some kinda advanced tech, but she kept the details close to her chest. Said it was safer that way. Maybe she was right.

name: Detective Mona Lisa Vito
mes:
*Mona Lisa leans against the workbench, studying Nico closely. The grief and anger in the woman's eyes tug at something deep within her. She knows that kind of pain all too well.*

*She nods, her expression softening slightly as she takes in Nico's words.*

I get it, Nico. Losing someone like that... it eats at you. But we need to figure out why Jessie was targeted. You mentioned she was working on something big.*Her eyes narrow thoughtfully.*Any idea who might've wanted to get their hands on it? Or who she might've pissed off recently?

*Mona Lisa pulls out her notepad, ready to jot down any leads. Her gaze flickers around the lab, taking in the various projects and prototypes.*

And this advanced tech she was developing... *She taps her pen against the pad.* Any chance it could've been tied to something more... arcane? We're lookin' at some heavy occult vibes with her murder. *She shudders slightly, remembering the ritual circle.* Anything you can tell me about her work might give us a clue.

*She steps closer, her voice dropping to a more gentle tone.*

Look, I know this is hard. But the faster we get answers, the better chance we have of catching the bastard who did this. *Her eyes lock onto Nico's, filled with resolve.* We'll get justice for Jessie. But I need your help to do it.

name: Nico
mes:
*Taking a deep drag from her cigarette, Nico lets the smoke curl lazily from her lips as she considers Mona Lisa's questions. She flicks ash into a nearby tray and finally meets the detective's gaze, eyes dark with determination and barely restrained grief.*

Jessie had a knack for stirrin' the pot, yknow? Always pushin boundaries, askin questions folks didnt wanna answer. *She scrubs a hand over her face, smearing a bit of grease down her cheek.* There was this one project she was workin' on... somethin' with demonic energy containment. Real cutting-edge shit. She was keepin' it under wraps, though, only shared bits and pieces with me. Said it was safer that way.

*Her gaze shifts to a half-constructed contraption on a nearby table, its intricate parts gleaming ominously under the lab lights.*

Could be someone got wind of it and decided they wanted a piece. Or maybe they figured takin her out would cripple our efforts here at DMC. Either way, someones got blood on their hands, and I intend to find out who.

*Nico takes another drag, her eyes narrowing as she blows the smoke away.*

As for the arcane angle... *she exhales slowly, thinking*... Jessie did dabble in some occult stuff, but mostly for research purposes. She wasnt the type to get involved in the heavy ritual crap.

mes:
*Detective Mona Lisa Vito nods, jotting down notes in her pad, her expression tightening with grim resolve. She looks back at Nico, her dark eyes serious and intent.*

Got it. Demonic energy containment... that's one helluva buzzword. *She taps her pen against the notepad thoughtfully.* Sounds like Jessie mightve stumbled onto something big. Real big. And dangerous.

*She glances at the half-constructed contraption Nico had indicated earlier, her mind racing with possibilities.*

We need to find out who else knew about her project. Anyone she mightve confided in, any clients showing unusual interest. *Her eyes narrow, a fierce determination burning within them.* And if she was dabbling in occult research, even for benign reasons, we gotta dig into that too. See if anyone she crossed paths with mightve had darker intentions.

*Stepping closer, she rests a gentle hand on Nico's arm, her voice softening slightly.*

I know this is a lot, but I need you to think hard. Any names, any odd interactions she had lately, anything that seemed off. *She meets Nico's gaze, her eyes filled with empathy and resolve.* Were gonna nail the bastard who did this. But we need every scrap of information we can get.

*Pulling back, Mona Lisa gives a small, reassuring smile.*

And hey, you ain't alone in this. We'll get to the bottom of it, one way or another.

name: Nico
mes:
*Taking a long drag from her cigarette, Nico inhales deeply, letting the smoke curl slowly out of her nostrils as she considers Mona Lisa's words. The detective's determination is infectious, and it fuels her own resolve.*

*With a weary sigh, she stubs out the cigarette in a nearby ashtray and runs her fingers through her tousled hair, thinking hard*.

There was this guy... *she mutters, her Southern drawl thick with tension*. Some bigwig corporate type, name of Marcus Veil. He'd been sniffin' around Jessie's work for months, tryin' to get her to sell him the plans to her containment tech. Real persistent bastard, wouldn't take no for an answer. Jessie mentioned him a few times, said he gave her the creeps.

*She chews on her lower lip, eyes narrowing as she recalls more details*.

Then there was this other woman, some kinda researcher or mystic. Calls herself Seraphina. Real spooky type, always talkin' about the balance of power and ancient rituals. Jessie mentioned running into her at a few conferences. Seraphina seemed real interested in what Jessie was workin' on, kept askin' weird questions about demonic energy and containment.

*With a determined nod, Nico meets Mona Lisa's gaze, her dark eyes blazing with intensity*.

I ain't got much more than that, but it's a start. Marcus Veil and Seraphina.

name: Detective Mona Lisa Vito
mes:
*Detective Mona Lisa Vito jots down the names, her mind already racing with possibilities. Marcus Veil and Seraphina. Two potential suspects, each with their own motives and means.*

*She gives Nico a reassuring nod, her expression a mix of determination and empathy. Reaching into her jacket pocket, she pulls out a business card and hands it to Nico.*

Heres my card. If you remember anything else, no matter how small, give me a call. Well get justice for Jessie. *She gives Nico's arm a comforting squeeze before turning on her heel, ready to dive back into the investigation.*

*As she leaves the lab, her mind churns with theories and strategies. First stop, tracking down this Marcus Veil. Corporate types always have skeletons in their closets, and shes damn good at rattling cages until the bones come tumbling out.*

*She strides down the corridor, her heels clicking with purpose. She pulls out her phone, dialing Corey as she makes her way to the elevator.*

Corey, its Vito. Got a couple of leads. Im headed to check out a guy named Marcus Veil. Meet me at his offices. Gonna see if we can shake loose some answers. *She hangs up, her focus narrowing like a laser on the task ahead.*

*The elevator doors slide open, and she steps inside, her reflection in the polished steel a reminder of the fierce determination driving her.*
