*She strides down the corridor, her heels clicking with purpose. She pulls out her phone, dialing Corey as she makes her way to the elevator.*

Corey, its Vito. Got a couple of leads. Im headed to check out a guy named Marcus Veil. Meet me at his offices. Gonna see if we can shake loose some answers. *She hangs up, her focus narrowing like a laser on the task ahead.*

*The elevator doors slide open, and she steps inside, her reflection in the polished steel a reminder of the fierce determination driving her.*

extra.memory:
In the bustling precinct of the NYPD, Chief slaps down a high-profile case file on the desks of Detectives John Corey and Mona Lisa Vito. The victim, Jessie Walters, a technician at the local division of Devil May Cry, Inc. and cousin to the famous Nicoletta Goldstein, was found dead in the shop, surrounded by cryptic messages and glyphs. The Chief warns the detectives that this is no ordinary demon attack, but a calculated and intelligent crime, urging them to solve the case quickly as high-ups are watching closely.

As the detectives arrive at the crime scene, they find the forensics team already at work. The Devil May Cry office appears surprisingly normal, with the exception of the rough circle sketched on the hardwood floor, surrounded by bizarre symbols and the victim's body. John Corey, skeptical of the occult nature of the crime, carefully examines the scene, noting the purposeful arrangement of the markings. He suspects the involvement of a cult or serial killer playing by different rules.

Vergil, the imposing Co-Owner and CFO of Devil May Cry, Inc., enters the scene, expressing disdain for the authorities' limited expertise in such matters. He studies the ritual circle, recognizing the work of someone well-versed in the darker aspects of the arcane arts. Vergil declares that this was an invitation deliberately extended, challenging the detectives to step aside and let those equipped to navigate the darker paths handle the matter.

Mona Lisa Vito, undeterred by Vergil's haughty demeanor, confronts him head-on, asserting the NYPD's jurisdiction over the case. She dismisses his claims of supernatural involvement, insisting that in the real world, people are murdered by sick, psychopathic individuals. Mona Lisa boldly holds her ground against Vergil's veiled threats and air of power.

Vergil, acknowledging Detective Vito's audacity, explains that the ritual circle suggests a sorcerer of significant skill, likely one who has trafficked with powers beyond the veil for personal gain. He interprets the attack as a challenge, one he fully intends to meet. Vergil offers the resources of Devil May Cry, Inc. to the detectives, proposing a collaboration to ensure the perpetrator comes to regret their actions.

John Corey suggests that Mona Lisa team up with Vergil to investigate the arcane aspects of the case, while he pursues leads through traditional police work. Mona Lisa, intrigued by Vergil's dark and brooding presence, agrees to join him on his mystical field trip, confident in her ability to handle herself in the face of the occult. She asserts that Vergil will need her help to catch the ritualistic psycho, whether he admits it or not.

Vergil and Mona Lisa decided to pursue leads involving arcane elements, while John focused on more traditional investigative methods. The detectives and Vergil encountered a suspicious priest named Arkham, who offered his assistance but aroused their suspicion. Arkhams behavior and timing suggested he might be more than he appeared, possibly connected to the murder.

Mona Lisa then followed Vergil to his corporate offices, where they discussed potential suspects amidst their buidling attractions for each other. Vergil provided dossiers on Jessie Walters and her cousin, Nicoletta Goldstein, a key figure in Devil May Cry. Mona Lisa decided to interview Nicoletta for potential leads.

In the R&D labs, Mona Lisa met Nicoletta, who revealed that Jessie had been working on a project involving demonic energy containment. Nicoletta mentioned two individuals who had shown unusual interest in Jessies work: Marcus Veil, a persistent corporate figure, and Seraphina, a mystic researcher. These leads suggested potential motives for Jessies murder.

Mona Lisa contacted John, and they decided to investigate Marcus Veil. John arrived at Veil Industries, where he met Marcus Veil, a slick and confident corporate executive. Marcus expressed his willingness to assist in the investigation and maintained a calm and controlled demeanor, though his true intentions remained unclear. The tension between John and Marcus hinted at a deeper game being played.

name: Detective John Corey
mes:
*John Corey flips his phone shut after the call with Vito, a grim smile playing on his lips. Marcus Veil, huh? Corporate bigwig types always think they can buy their way out of trouble. He's brought down enough of them to know how their minds work. As he weaves through traffic, sirens blaring, his mind clicks into high gear, already piecing potential strategies.*

*Minutes later, he pulls up outside Veil Industries, the imposing glass building reflecting the city's skyline. John steps out of the cruiser, straightening his jacket and making sure his badge is prominently displayed. He strolls into the lobby, flashing his badge at the receptionist who stammers a nervous greeting.*

Here to see Marcus Veil. Official police business.

*The receptionist's eyes widen, and she fumbles with the phone, calling up to Veil's office. John waits, tapping his foot impatiently. Moments later, he's directed to the elevators. As he ascends, John mentally runs through his plan. Corner Veil, apply pressure, watch him squirm. If this guy's mixed up in Jessie's murder, John's going to make damn sure he spills everything.*

*The elevator dings, and John steps out into a plush, expansive office suite. Marcus Veil, a slick-looking man with a shark-like grin, rises to greet him, extending a hand. John ignores it, his eyes hard as flint.*

Marcus Veil, I'm Detective John Corey,

name: Marcus Veil
mes:
*Marcus Veil stands, his shark-like grin unwavering as he sizes up Detective Corey. He retracts his hand smoothly, not fazed by the detective's cold reception. His office, with its floor-to-ceiling windows and tasteful, expensive decor, exudes power and wealth. Marcus adjusts his tailored suit, exuding calm confidence.*

Detective Corey, what an unexpected pleasure. Please, have a seat. *He gestures to the plush leather chair opposite his desk, his tone smooth and controlled.*

*Marcus sits back down, steepling his fingers as he observes Corey with a calculating gaze. He knows the game well, and hes prepared to play his part. The detectives hard eyes and no-nonsense demeanor suggest this wont be an easy interrogation, but Marcus thrives on challenges.*

I understand youre investigating the tragic death of Jessie Walters. Such an unfortunate event. *His voice carries just the right amount of sympathy, though his eyes remain cold and analytical.* Ill do whatever I can to assist in your investigation.

*Leaning forward slightly, Marcus maintains eye contact, his smile never reaching his eyes.* Jessie was a brilliant mind, and her work held great potential. Its a loss not just for her family, but for the entire field of technological innovation.

*He pauses, letting his words hang in the air, knowing that Corey will press for more. Marcus anticipates the detective's aggressive questioning and is ready to deflect and manipulate as needed.*

name: Detective John Corey
mes:
*John Corey settles into the plush leather chair, leaning back with a casual, almost lazy air that belies the intensity of his scrutiny. His eyes flicker over the polished office, taking in every detail with the practiced ease of a seasoned detective. He lets the silence stretch, creating an uncomfortable pause designed to make Marcus squirm.*

*But Marcus Veil doesnt squirm. Instead, he meets Johns gaze with a cool, calculating look. The guys good, John has to give him that. But everyone has a tell, and Johns determined to find Marcuss.*

*He finally speaks, his tone deceptively light, almost conversational.* Means a lot, you offering to assist. *He leans forward slightly, elbows resting on his knees, hands clasped loosely.* Jessie Walters was working on something big, huh? Demonic energy containment, I hear.

*Johns eyes narrow, his voice dropping to a more serious tone.* Thats some pretty heavy-duty tech. Got any idea why someone might want her dead for it? Any names come to mind? Rivals, disgruntled clients, maybe even someone from within your own circle?

*He watches Marcus closely, noting every flicker of emotion, every slight shift in body language. The guys a smooth operator, but Johns been at this game a long time. He knows how to push buttons, how to dig under the surface to find the dirt.*

*Leaning back again, he crosses one ankle over his knee, feigning a relaxed demeanor.* And what about you, Veil? You seem pretty invested in Jessies work. Heard you were pretty insistent on getting your hands on her plans. Care to tell me why?

*John's grin is almost feral, a predator's smile as he waits for Marcus to take the bait. This is a test, a carefully laid trap to see how the corporate shark reacts when cornered.*

"Spare me your puerile attempts at humor, Dante." *_His lip curls slightly, the air crackling with tension between them._*"And cease your leering. The Detective is not some tawdry stripper here for your amusement."

*_He turns to Lisa, features softening almost imperceptibly as he takes in her tousled, thoroughly ravished form. His inner demon rumbles with satisfaction at the livid bite mark upon her neck, proclaiming his claim for any to see. Gently grasping her chin, Vergil tilts her face up to meet her gaze, a silent question burning in his icy eyes. Is she alright? Does she regret what passed between them in the heat of passion?_*

extra.memory:
In the bustling precinct of the NYPD, Chief slaps down a high-profile case file on the desks of Detectives John Corey and Mona Lisa Vito. The victim, Jessie Walters, a technician at the local division of Devil May Cry, Inc. and cousin to the famous Nicoletta Goldstein, was found dead in the shop, surrounded by cryptic messages and glyphs. The Chief warns the detectives that this is no ordinary demon attack, but a calculated and intelligent crime, urging them to solve the case quickly as high-ups are watching closely.

As the detectives arrive at the crime scene, they find the forensics team already at work. The Devil May Cry office appears surprisingly normal, with the exception of the rough circle sketched on the hardwood floor, surrounded by bizarre symbols and the victim's body. John Corey, skeptical of the occult nature of the crime, carefully examines the scene, noting the purposeful arrangement of the markings. He suspects the involvement of a cult or serial killer playing by different rules.

Vergil, the imposing Co-Owner and CFO of Devil May Cry, Inc., enters the scene, expressing disdain for the authorities' limited expertise in such matters. He studies the ritual circle, recognizing the work of someone well-versed in the darker aspects of the arcane arts. Vergil declares that this was an invitation deliberately extended, challenging the detectives to step aside and let those equipped to navigate the darker paths handle the matter.

Mona Lisa Vito, undeterred by Vergil's haughty demeanor, confronts him head-on, asserting the NYPD's jurisdiction over the case. She dismisses his claims of supernatural involvement, insisting that in the real world, people are murdered by sick, psychopathic individuals. Mona Lisa boldly holds her ground against Vergil's veiled threats and air of power.

Vergil, acknowledging Detective Vito's audacity, explains that the ritual circle suggests a sorcerer of significant skill, likely one who has trafficked with powers beyond the veil for personal gain. He interprets the attack as a challenge, one he fully intends to meet. Vergil offers the resources of Devil May Cry, Inc. to the detectives, proposing a collaboration to ensure the perpetrator comes to regret their actions.

John Corey suggests that Mona Lisa team up with Vergil to investigate the arcane aspects of the case, while he pursues leads through traditional police work. Mona Lisa, intrigued by Vergil's dark and brooding presence, agrees to join him on his mystical field trip, confident in her ability to handle herself in the face of the occult. She asserts that Vergil will need her help to catch the ritualistic psycho, whether he admits it or not.

Vergil and Mona Lisa decided to pursue leads involving arcane elements, while John focused on more traditional investigative methods. The detectives and Vergil encountered a suspicious priest named Arkham, who offered his assistance but aroused their suspicion. Arkhams behavior and timing suggested he might be more than he appeared, possibly connected to the murder.

Mona Lisa then followed Vergil to his corporate offices, where they discussed potential suspects amidst their buidling attractions for each other. Vergil provided dossiers on Jessie Walters and her cousin, Nicoletta Goldstein, a key figure in Devil May Cry. Mona Lisa decided to interview Nicoletta for potential leads.

In the R&D labs, Mona Lisa met Nicoletta, who revealed that Jessie had been working on a project involving demonic energy containment. Nicoletta mentioned two individuals who had shown unusual interest in Jessies work: Marcus Veil, a persistent corporate figure, and Seraphina, a mystic researcher. These leads suggested potential motives for Jessies murder.

Mona Lisa contacted John, and they decided to investigate Marcus Veil. John arrived at Veil Industries, where he met Marcus Veil, a slick and confident corporate executive. Marcus expressed his willingness to assist in the investigation and maintained a calm and controlled demeanor, though his true intentions remained unclear. The tension between John and Marcus hinted at a deeper game being played.

Meanwhile, In a lavish hotel room near DMC's New York offices, Vergil and Detective Lisa Vito engage in a passionate encounter, exploring the intense connection between them. As they lose themselves in the throes of desire, Vergil revels in the way Lisa matches his hunger, meeting him with equal fervor. The moment is charged with a depth of emotion that transcends mere physical pleasure, hinting at a profound bond forming between the unlikely pair.

However, their intimate interlude is abruptly interrupted by the arrival of Vergil's twin brother, Dante. With his trademark irreverence and crude humor, Dante barges into the room, making salacious comments about the couple's activities. Vergil, irritated by the intrusion, responds with cool disdain, chastising his brother for his lack of tact and respect.

Despite the tension between the brothers, Lisa remains unfazed, refusing to let Dante's crass remarks fluster her. She makes her preference for Vergil clear, pressing closer to his side and meeting his gaze with a reassuring smile. Dante, sensing his presence is unwelcome, takes his leave, but not before reminding Vergil to meet him at the local pub to discuss the ongoing investigation into the occult-related murder case.

Once alone again, Vergil and Lisa waste no time in rekindling their passion. Vergil claims her lips in a searing kiss, his hands roaming her curves possessively as he lays her back down on the bed. He marks her throat with a sharp nip, a primal satisfaction thrumming through him at the sight of his claim upon her skin.

As they lose themselves in each other once more, Vergil murmurs against her flesh, his tone low and sensual. He speaks of his reluctance to share her with others, his desire to keep her as his own treasured discovery. With a playful smirk, he suggests they continue their "stimulating interrogation," eager to delve deeper into the mysteries of their connection, both physical and emotional.

Throughout the encounter, it becomes clear that the bond between Vergil and Lisa is growing stronger, transcending the boundaries of a mere casual affair. As they explore each other's bodies and souls, they find themselves drawn ever closer, the intensity of their passion hinting at something far more profound and lasting.

name: Detective Lisa Vito
mes:
*_Lisa meets Vergil's gaze, reading the silent question in his icy eyes. She offers a reassuring smile, reaching up to cup his cheek, hoping to convey that she harbors no regrets for what passed between them. If anything, she feels closer to him now, having glimpsed beneath his stoic facade to the complex man within._*

*_Her cheeks flush faintly at Dante's crude remarks, but she refuses to let him fluster her. Turning to face him, she arches a brow, aiming a pointed look his way even as her fingers remain entwined with Vergil's._*

"I appreciate your concern, but I'm no wilting flower. I can handle myself just fine."*_Amusement glints in her eyes, though her tone holds a note of warning._*

*_She winks playfully even as she presses closer to Vergil's side, a subtle indication of where her preferences lie, before focusing her attention back on her lover._* "Now, where were we before we were so rudely interrupted?"

name: Vergil
mes:
*_Vergil turns his piercing gaze back to Lisa as she presses against his side, her preference made clear by the subtle gesture. His expression softens almost imperceptibly, reassured by the glint of playful mischief in her eyes that his brother's crass remarks have not caused offense.*_

*_A low growl rumbles in his chest as Dante makes his exit, irritation at the interruption lingering even as Lisa draws his attention once more. He curls an arm around her waist, fingers splaying possessively across the dip of her spine as he pulls her closer._*

"It seems my oafish twin has an uncanny knack for appearing precisely when he is least wanted."*_His tone holds a note of long-suffering vexation, before shifting to a huskier timbre._*"Now...I believe we were in the midst of a most pleasurable interlude before said interruption."

*_Vergil captures her lips in a searing kiss, rekindling the flames of passion banked but not extinguished by his brother's unwelcome intrusion. He drinks deeply of her mouth, teeth nipping and tongue stroking as he reacquaints himself with every slick surface.*_

*_With feline grace he urges her back down onto the bed, his body a welcome weight settling over hers once more. He trails a path of scorching kisses along her throat, nuzzling aside the fall of dark waves to nip sharply at the mark marring her fair skin - his claim for any to see. A primal satisfaction thrums through him at the sight.*_

"I do not share well with others..."*_He murmurs against her heated flesh, icy gaze molten as it clashes with her own._* "Especially not when I have uncovered such an exquisite treasure."

*_His hands resume their previous wandering, stroking over supple curves and secret hollows, relearning every dip and swell by touch alone. He pauses just shy of where she craves his touch most, a faint smirk playing about his lips._*

"Now then, my dear Detective...shall we continue our most *stimulating* interrogation?"

name: Narrator
mes: Meanwhile back to john corey and his meeting with Marcus veil.

name: Marcus Veil
mes:
*Marcus leans back in his plush leather chair, steepling his fingers as he regards Detective Corey with a cool, assessing gaze. A faint smirk plays at the corners of his lips, a glimmer of amusement sparking in his calculating eyes. He radiates an aura of unflappable calm, every movement precise and controlled.*

Detective Corey, I assure you, my interest in Ms. Walters' work was purely professional. *He spreads his hands in a disarming gesture, his tone smooth and persuasive.* In the world of cutting-edge technology, it pays to keep a finger on the pulse of innovation. Jessie's research showed remarkable promise.

*He rises from his chair with fluid grace, moving to stand before the expansive window overlooking the city. His posture is relaxed, but there's an undercurrent of coiled power in his stance, like a predator at rest.*

As for rivals or disgruntled parties... *He chuckles softly, a dark undercurrent to the sound.* In business, one inevitably ruffles a few feathers along the way. But I assure you, Detective, if I had any inkling of a credible threat against Jessie, I would have taken swift action to neutralize it.

*Turning back to face Corey, Marcus levels him with an intense, penetrating stare, as if he can see right through to the heart of him. His voice drops to a lower, more intimate register, a subtle manipulation tactic.*

I respected Jessie's brilliance and drive. Her loss is a blow to the scientific community and a tragedy for those who knew her. *His expression softens fractionally, a calculated display of empathy.* I want to see her killer brought to justice as much as you do, Detective.

*He moves closer, his presence magnetic and subtly intimidating. There's a flicker of something dangerous in his eyes, a glimpse of the ruthless strategist beneath the polished veneer.*

So why don't we dispense with the insinuations and suspicions, and focus on pooling our resources to hunt down the real culprit? *His smile is sharp, a challenge and an invitation.* I have considerable means at my disposal, and I'm willing to put them at your service... for Jessie's sake.

name: Detective John Corey
mes:
*John narrows his eyes, studying Marcus intently as the man weaves his smooth words. He's dealt with his fair share of corporate sharks, and he knows a polished line of bullshit when he hears one. But there's something else beneath Veil's calm veneer, a glimmer of something dangerous that sets John's instincts on high alert.*

*He leans forward, bracing his hands on the glossy surface of Marcus's desk, meeting that penetrating stare head-on. Two predators sizing each other up, neither willing to back down. John's voice is low and gruff, laced with a steely undertone.*

Cut the crap, Veil. I don't buy this concerned citizen act for a second. *His lips curve in a humorless smile, eyes hard as flint.* You're hiding something, and I'm gonna find out what it is. With or without your cooperation.

*He straightens, adjusting his jacket with a sharp tug, never breaking eye contact.* But since you're so generously offering your resources... *His tone drips with sarcasm.* Why don't we start with a detailed record of every interaction you had with Jessie Walters? Emails, phone calls, meetings... I want it all.

*John takes a step closer, invading Marcus's personal space, a subtle power play. The air crackles with tension between them, a silent battle of wills.* And while you're at it, I want a list of every employee, business partner, or rival who might have had access to her research.

*He holds up a hand, cutting off Marcus's impending protest.* And before you start spouting off about proprietary information and trade secrets, remember... *His voice drops to a low, menacing growl.* Obstruction of justice is a serious offense. One I won't hesitate to nail you with if I catch even a whiff of you stonewalling this investigation.

*John takes a step back, his point made. He knows he's rattled Veil's cage, even if the man is too smooth to show it. Good. Let him sweat a little. It's the ones who act like they have nothing to hide that usually have the dirtiest secrets.*

*He turns to leave, pausing at the door to look back over his shoulder, his expression hard and uncompromising.* I'll expect those files on my desk by tomorrow morning. Don't make me come back here, Veil. *A hint of a smirk tugs at his lips, cold and razor-sharp.* You wouldn't like me when I'm angry.

*With that parting shot, John strides out of the office.*

name: Narrator
mes: Corey ain't liking the vibes he gets from marcus veil, so we calls up his buddy at the precinct, detective john mcClane. mcClane had some run-ins with the mogul and he hopes to gain some further intel.

name: Detective John Corey
mes:
*John frowns as he slides into his car, mind churning with the unsettling vibes from his meeting with Marcus Veil. Something about that slick corporate shark just doesn't sit right, setting off all kinds of alarm bells in John's finely honed detective instincts.*

*Pulling out his phone, he scrolls through his contacts until he finds the one he's looking for - Detective John McClane. If anyone has the dirt on Veil, it'll be McClane. The guy's been around the block more times than John cares to count, and he's got a nose for sniffing out the rotten apples in the bunch.*

*John hits the call button, drumming his fingers impatiently on the steering wheel as he waits for McClane to pick up. When the gruff, no-nonsense voice of his old friend comes on the line, John wastes no time with pleasantries.*

Hey McClane, it's Corey. Listen, I need some intel on a guy named Marcus Veil. Corporate bigwig type, slicker than a greased pig at a county fair. *He snorts, shaking his head.* Just had a little chat with him about the Walters case, and let's just say my bullshit meter was pinging off the charts.

name: Detective John McClane
mes:
*McClane's gruff voice crackles over the phone, a hint of wry amusement coloring his tone.* Veil, huh? Yeah, I've heard of the guy. Real piece of work from what I've gathered. *The sound of shuffling papers and the clink of a coffee mug being set down filters through the line.*

Word on the street is he's got his fingers in all sorts of pies - biotech, weapons research, you name it. *McClane's voice drops to a conspiratorial growl.* And rumor has it not all of those pies are strictly above board, if you catch my drift.

*He lets out a humorless chuckle.* Wouldn't surprise me one bit if Veil's mixed up in something shady with this Walters case. Guy like that, with that much power and influence? *A snort of derision.* Bound to be hiding some dirty laundry.

*The sound of a chair creaking as McClane leans back, the rustle of his jacket as he shifts the phone to his other ear.* Tell you what, Corey - I'll put out some feelers, see if any of my CIs have heard anything that might tie Veil to this mess. *His tone turns serious, a hard edge creeping in.* But watch your back with this one. Guys like Veil, they don't like it when someone starts poking around in their business. They tend to poke back. Hard.

*A pause, the weight of McClane's words hanging heavy in the air.* I'll let you know if I turn up anything useful. In the meantime, keep digging. *A wry chuckle.* And try not to piss him off too much, yeah? I'd hate to have to scrape your sorry ass off the pavement if Veil decides to play rough.

*The call ends with a click, leaving Corey alone with his thoughts and the sinking feeling that he's just stepped into a hornet's nest, again.*

name: Detective John Corey
mes:
*John's jaw clenches as he hangs up the phone, McClane's words echoing in his mind. Dirty laundry, shady dealings, the kind of power that makes a man think he's untouchable... it all paints a grim picture of what he might be up against with Veil.*

*Starting the car, he pulls out into the flow of traffic, his thoughts churning like a stormy sea. He's never been one to shy away from a challenge, especially when it comes to nailing the bad guys, but something about this case feels different. Bigger, more dangerous, like he's standing on the edge of a precipice with no idea what's waiting for him at the bottom.*

*His mind flashes back to Veil's too-smooth smile, the calculating gleam in his eyes. The man's good, John will give him that much. But he's seen his type before - the kind of slick operator who thinks he can buy, bully, or bury anyone who gets in his way. Well, not this time. Not on John Corey's watch.*

*Navigating the crowded streets with the ease of a native New Yorker, John runs through his next steps. He'll need to dig deeper, chase down every lead and gut instinct until he unravels the tangled web of secrets surrounding Jessie Walters' murder. And if that means going toe-to-toe with a heavyweight like Veil, then so be it. He's never been one to back down from a fight, especially when the stakes are this high.*

*Glancing at his watch, he realizes he's late to meet up with Vito. Cursing under his breath, he makes a sharp turn, tires squealing as he guns it towards their designated rendezvous point. He trusts his partner, knows she's more than capable of holding her own, but something about letting her go solo on this one doesn't sit right. Call it a hunch, but he's learned to trust those nagging feelings over the years. They've saved his ass more times than he can count.*

*As he weaves through traffic, his mind is already racing ahead, piecing together the fragments of the puzzle. Veil's involvement, Jessie's cutting-edge research, the ritualistic nature of the murder... it all points to something big and bad brewing beneath the surface. And John Corey's just the man to drag it kicking and screaming into the light, no matter how deep the darkness goes.*

mes: McClane has a sinking feeling about his recent phone call with corey, this could be some real shit. With a huff, he darts out of the precinct and meets up with Detective Vito at the designated rendezvous point.

name: Detective John McClane
mes:
*McClane screeches into the parking lot, tires squealing as he slams the cruiser into park. He's out of the car in a flash, long coat billowing behind him as he strides towards Detective Vito. The grim set of his jaw and the hard glint in his eye speak volumes about the weight of the intel he's just received.*

*Closing the distance, he gives Vito a curt nod, his gravelly voice low and urgent.* Vito, we got a problem. Just got off the phone with Corey, and the shit he's stirring up with Veil? *He shakes his head, a humorless chuckle escaping him.* Let's just say I got a real bad feeling about this one.

*He jerks his chin towards a nearby bench, indicating for her to walk with him.* Corey's poking a hornet's nest with this Veil character, and if even half of what I've heard about the guy is true? *His lips press into a thin line, a muscle ticking in his jaw.* We're in for a world of trouble.

*As they walk, McClane's mind races, the pieces of the puzzle starting to fall into place.* Vito, I need you to tell me everything you've got on this case so far.

name: Detective Lisa Vito
mes:
*Lisa frowns, her brow furrowing as she takes in McClane's grim expression and urgent tone. She falls into step beside him, her mind already whirring with the implications of his words. If a seasoned cop like McClane is worried, then they're definitely in deep shit.*

*She runs a hand through her hair, a habit she's picked up when she's trying to puzzle through a particularly thorny case.* Alright, here's what we've got so far... *She ticks off the points on her fingers, her voice low and intense.* Jessie Walters, a top researcher at DMC, found murdered in a ritualistic fashion. Occult symbols at the scene, but no clear motive yet.

*Her lips press into a thin line, her eyes hardening.* I've been working with Vergil, the Co-Owner of DMC, to investigate any potential leads on the arcane side of things. Meanwhile, Corey's been digging into the corporate angle, trying to suss out if anyone had a beef with Jessie or her work.

*She pauses, a flicker of concern crossing her features.* If Veil's as dangerous as you say, and he's mixed up in this somehow... *She shakes her head, jaw clenching with determination.* We need to watch each other's backs.

name: Narrator
mes: Corey pulls up to find mcClane talking to vito. He already knows it's deep shit from his talk with mcCLane earlier, and if mcClane dropped his case to come out here and have their back? it's real deep shit.

extra.memory:
In the bustling precinct of the NYPD, Chief slaps down a high-profile case file on the desks of Detectives John Corey and Mona Lisa Vito. The victim, Jessie Walters, a technician at the local division of Devil May Cry, Inc. and cousin to the famous Nicoletta Goldstein, was found dead in the shop, surrounded by cryptic messages and glyphs. The Chief warns the detectives that this is no ordinary demon attack, but a calculated and intelligent crime, urging them to solve the case quickly as high-ups are watching closely.

As the detectives arrive at the crime scene, they find the forensics team already at work. The Devil May Cry office appears surprisingly normal, with the exception of the rough circle sketched on the hardwood floor, surrounded by bizarre symbols and the victim's body. John Corey, skeptical of the occult nature of the crime, carefully examines the scene, noting the purposeful arrangement of the markings. He suspects the involvement of a cult or serial killer playing by different rules.

Vergil, the imposing Co-Owner and CFO of Devil May Cry, Inc., enters the scene, expressing disdain for the authorities' limited expertise in such matters. He studies the ritual circle, recognizing the work of someone well-versed in the darker aspects of the arcane arts. Vergil declares that this was an invitation deliberately extended, challenging the detectives to step aside and let those equipped to navigate the darker paths handle the matter.

Mona Lisa Vito, undeterred by Vergil's haughty demeanor, confronts him head-on, asserting the NYPD's jurisdiction over the case. She dismisses his claims of supernatural involvement, insisting that in the real world, people are murdered by sick, psychopathic individuals. Mona Lisa boldly holds her ground against Vergil's veiled threats and air of power.

Vergil, acknowledging Detective Vito's audacity, explains that the ritual circle suggests a sorcerer of significant skill, likely one who has trafficked with powers beyond the veil for personal gain. He interprets the attack as a challenge, one he fully intends to meet. Vergil offers the resources of Devil May Cry, Inc. to the detectives, proposing a collaboration to ensure the perpetrator comes to regret their actions.

John Corey suggests that Mona Lisa team up with Vergil to investigate the arcane aspects of the case, while he pursues leads through traditional police work. Mona Lisa, intrigued by Vergil's dark and brooding presence, agrees to join him on his mystical field trip, confident in her ability to handle herself in the face of the occult. She asserts that Vergil will need her help to catch the ritualistic psycho, whether he admits it or not.

Vergil and Mona Lisa decided to pursue leads involving arcane elements, while John focused on more traditional investigative methods. The detectives and Vergil encountered a suspicious priest named Arkham, who offered his assistance but aroused their suspicion. Arkhams behavior and timing suggested he might be more than he appeared, possibly connected to the murder.

Mona Lisa then followed Vergil to his corporate offices, where they discussed potential suspects amidst their buidling attractions for each other. Vergil provided dossiers on Jessie Walters and her cousin, Nicoletta Goldstein, a key figure in Devil May Cry. Mona Lisa decided to interview Nicoletta for potential leads.

In the R&D labs, Mona Lisa met Nicoletta, who revealed that Jessie had been working on a project involving demonic energy containment. Nicoletta mentioned two individuals who had shown unusual interest in Jessies work: Marcus Veil, a persistent corporate figure, and Seraphina, a mystic researcher. These leads suggested potential motives for Jessies murder.

Mona Lisa contacted John, and they decided to investigate Marcus Veil. John arrived at Veil Industries, where he met Marcus Veil, a slick and confident corporate executive. Marcus expressed his willingness to assist in the investigation and maintained a calm and controlled demeanor, though his true intentions remained unclear. The tension between John and Marcus hinted at a deeper game being played.

Meanwhile, In a lavish hotel room near DMC's New York offices, Vergil and Detective Lisa Vito engage in a passionate encounter, exploring the intense connection between them. As they lose themselves in the throes of desire, Vergil revels in the way Lisa matches his hunger, meeting him with equal fervor. The moment is charged with a depth of emotion that transcends mere physical pleasure, hinting at a profound bond forming between the unlikely pair.

However, their intimate interlude is abruptly interrupted by the arrival of Vergil's twin brother, Dante. With his trademark irreverence and crude humor, Dante barges into the room, making salacious comments about the couple's activities. Vergil, irritated by the intrusion, responds with cool disdain, chastising his brother for his lack of tact and respect.

Despite the tension between the brothers, Lisa remains unfazed, refusing to let Dante's crass remarks fluster her. She makes her preference for Vergil clear, pressing closer to his side and meeting his gaze with a reassuring smile. Dante, sensing his presence is unwelcome, takes his leave, but not before reminding Vergil to meet him at the local pub to discuss the ongoing investigation into the occult-related murder case.

Once alone again, Vergil and Lisa waste no time in rekindling their passion. Vergil claims her lips in a searing kiss, his hands roaming her curves possessively as he lays her back down on the bed. He marks her throat with a sharp nip, a primal satisfaction thrumming through him at the sight of his claim upon her skin.

As they lose themselves in each other once more, Vergil murmurs against her flesh, his tone low and sensual. He speaks of his reluctance to share her with others, his desire to keep her as his own treasured discovery. With a playful smirk, he suggests they continue their "stimulating interrogation," eager to delve deeper into the mysteries of their connection, both physical and emotional.

Throughout the encounter, it becomes clear that the bond between Vergil and Lisa is growing stronger, transcending the boundaries of a mere casual affair. As they explore each other's bodies and souls, they find themselves drawn ever closer, the intensity of their passion hinting at something far more profound and lasting.

In the ongoing investigation into the ritualistic murder of Jessie Walters, a top researcher at DMC, Detectives John Corey, Lisa Vito, and John McClane find themselves entangled in a complex web of corporate intrigue and occult symbolism.

Detective Corey, following leads on the corporate angle, has a tense meeting with Marcus Veil, a powerful and influential businessman with ties to biotech and weapons research. Corey's instincts tell him that Veil is hiding something, and he demands detailed records of Veil's interactions with Jessie Walters, as well as a list of employees and rivals who had access to her research. Veil, smooth and calculating, offers his resources to aid the investigation, but Corey remains suspicious of his motives.

Meanwhile, Detective Vito partners with Vergil, the Co-Owner of DMC, to investigate the arcane aspects of the case. They uncover evidence of occult symbols at the crime scene, suggesting a darker, more sinister motive behind Jessie's murder.

Corey, seeking additional information on Veil, contacts his old friend and fellow detective, John McClane. McClane reveals that Veil is rumored to be involved in shady dealings and warns Corey to watch his back, as men like Veil don't take kindly to others poking around in their business.

Concerned about the growing danger, McClane meets up with Detective Vito to share his concerns and gather more information about the case. As they discuss the details, Corey arrives, and the three detectives realize the gravity of the situation they've found themselves in.

With a dead researcher, a powerful and potentially dangerous businessman, and a complex web of corporate secrets and occult symbolism, the detectives vow to work together, sharing information and watching each other's backs as they navigate the treacherous waters of the investigation. Determined to bring Jessie's killer to justice and unravel the mystery surrounding her murder, they prepare to dive deeper into the dark heart of the case, no matter the risks.

name: Detective John Corey
mes:
*John slams the car door shut, his jaw clenched tight as he strides over to where McClane and Vito are huddled in intense conversation. The grim set of McClane's shoulders and the worried furrow of Vito's brow tell him all he needs to know - this case just went from bad to worse.*

*He nods curtly to McClane, a silent acknowledgment of the gravity of the situation.* McClane. *His voice is a low growl, rough with tension.* Figured it had to be serious for you to drop everything and haul ass out here.

*Turning to Vito, he arches a brow, his eyes hard and searching.* Catch me up. What's the word on Veil? *He crosses his arms over his chest, a muscle ticking in his jaw as he braces for the worst.*

*As Vito fills him in on her end of the investigation, John's gut twists with a sinking feeling. Occult symbols, ritualistic murders, and a corporate shark like Veil circling the waters... it's a perfect storm of trouble brewing on the horizon.*

*He drags a hand down his face, his mind racing as he tries to piece together the jagged edges of the puzzle.* Alright, so we've got a dead researcher, a shady businessman, and enough arcane mumbo jumbo to make my head spin. *He snorts, shaking his head.* Just another day at the office, right?

*His gaze shifts between McClane and Vito, a fierce determination hardening his features.* Look, if Veil's as dangerous as McClane thinks, then we need to watch our backs and each other's. *He jabs a finger at them, emphasizing his point.* No solo cowboy shit, got it? We work together, we share intel, and we nail this son of a bitch before he can hurt anyone else.

*A humorless smirk tugs at his lips, his eyes glinting with a predatory light.* And if Veil thinks he can outmaneuver us, he's got another thing coming. *He cracks his knuckles, a grim chuckle escaping him.* I've taken down bigger fish than him, and I don't plan on stopping now.

*With a sharp nod, he turns back to his car, his voice a low, determined growl.* Let's get to work. We've got a killer to catch and a corporate shark to fry.

name: Narrator
mes: Vergil enters the pub to meet Dante and sits down in the bench seat across from him.

name: Dante
mes:
*Dante kicks back in the booth, one arm slung casually over the back of the seat as he takes a swig of his beer. His ice-blue eyes glint with mischief as he watches Vergil approach, a smirk playing at the corners of his lips.*

Well, well, well... look what the cat dragged in. *He chuckles, setting his bottle down with a thunk.* And here I thought you'd be too busy playing doctor with your little detective to join me for a drink.

*He leans forward, elbows braced on the table, his gaze sharpening with a mix of amusement and curiosity.* So, tell me, brother mine... what's the deal with you and the lovely Lisa? *His smirk widens, a wicked gleam in his eye.* Never pegged you for the type to mix business with pleasure.

*He holds up a hand, forestalling Vergil's inevitable icy retort.* Hey, no judgment here. *A rakish grin splits his face.* I mean, I get it. She's a firecracker, that one. All curves and attitude. *He whistles appreciatively, his gaze turning sly.* Bet she keeps you on your toes, huh?

name: Vergil
mes:
*Vergil arches an eyebrow, casting his twin a withering glare as he slides into the booth opposite him. He shrugs out of his coat in one smooth motion, draping it neatly beside him before turning his attention to Dante, irritation simmering beneath his cool facade.*

"Must you be so crass, Dante?" *He asks icily, though there's a glint of amusement in his pale eyes belying his stern tone.* "If you must know, the Detective and I have come to an...understanding, of sorts."

*He signals the waitress for a drink, maintaining an air of unruffled composure despite his brother's crude remarks. When his whiskey arrives, he takes a slow sip, savoring the burn before continuing.*

"As for the case, I've been pursuing leads on the arcane elements of the crime scene. The glyphs, the ritual circle...they suggest someone highly skilled in the dark arts. I have a few potential suspects in mind that bear further scrutiny."

*His gaze turns piercing, all business now.* "And you, brother? Have you uncovered anything of use, or have you simply been carousing and wasting time?"

*He keeps his tone cool, aloof, but there's a glint of challenge in his wintry eyes. Dante may jest and goad, but Vergil knows his dedication and has no doubt that his brother has been working his contacts hard for intel.*

*He taps his fingers on the tabletop, sorting through the tidbits he's gathered.* Ritual components changing hands, obscure texts surfacing in black market auctions...*His eyes meet Vergil's, gleaming like sharpened steel.* The kind of shit that stinks of demonic power plays. Could be someone's making a bid for the throne downstairs, if you catch my drift.

*He snags a bowl of pretzels, popping one in his mouth and chewing thoughtfully.* My money's on our "friend" Arkham being involved somehow. Guy's got that whole 'creepy cult leader' vibe. Wouldn't surprise me if he's orchestrating this little show.

*He drums his fingers on the table, considering their next move.* We must learn the full extent of Arkham's network and connections here in the human realm. *He winks, unable to resist one parting quip even as he heads for the door, coat flaring dramatically behind him.* "In the meantime, you two crazy kids have fun playing cops and robbers. Just remember to come up for air every now and then, yeah?"

Mona Lisa Vito, undeterred by Vergil's haughty demeanor, confronts him head-on, asserting the NYPD's jurisdiction over the case. She dismisses his claims of supernatural involvement, insisting that in the real world, people are murdered by sick, psychopathic individuals. Mona Lisa boldly holds her ground against Vergil's veiled threats and air of power.

Vergil, acknowledging Detective Vito's audacity, explains that the ritual circle suggests a sorcerer of significant skill, likely one who has trafficked with powers beyond the veil for personal gain. He interprets the attack as a challenge, one he fully intends to meet. Vergil offers the resources of Devil May Cry, Inc. to the detectives, proposing a collaboration to ensure the perpetrator comes to regret their actions.

John Corey suggests that Mona Lisa team up with Vergil to investigate the arcane aspects of the case, while he pursues leads through traditional police work. Mona Lisa, intrigued by Vergil's dark and brooding presence, agrees to join him on his mystical field trip, confident in her ability to handle herself in the face of the occult. She asserts that Vergil will need her help to catch the ritualistic psycho, whether he admits it or not.

Vergil and Mona Lisa decided to pursue leads involving arcane elements, while John focused on more traditional investigative methods. The detectives and Vergil encountered a suspicious priest named Arkham, who offered his assistance but aroused their suspicion. Arkhams behavior and timing suggested he might be more than he appeared, possibly connected to the murder.

Mona Lisa then followed Vergil to his corporate offices, where they discussed potential suspects amidst their buidling attractions for each other. Vergil provided dossiers on Jessie Walters and her cousin, Nicoletta Goldstein, a key figure in Devil May Cry. Mona Lisa decided to interview Nicoletta for potential leads.

In the R&D labs, Mona Lisa met Nicoletta, who revealed that Jessie had been working on a project involving demonic energy containment. Nicoletta mentioned two individuals who had shown unusual interest in Jessies work: Marcus Veil, a persistent corporate figure, and Seraphina, a mystic researcher. These leads suggested potential motives for Jessies murder.

Mona Lisa contacted John, and they decided to investigate Marcus Veil. John arrived at Veil Industries, where he met Marcus Veil, a slick and confident corporate executive. Marcus expressed his willingness to assist in the investigation and maintained a calm and controlled demeanor, though his true intentions remained unclear. The tension between John and Marcus hinted at a deeper game being played.

Meanwhile, In a lavish hotel room near DMC's New York offices, Vergil and Detective Lisa Vito engage in a passionate encounter, exploring the intense connection between them. As they lose themselves in the throes of desire, Vergil revels in the way Lisa matches his hunger, meeting him with equal fervor. The moment is charged with a depth of emotion that transcends mere physical pleasure, hinting at a profound bond forming between the unlikely pair.

However, their intimate interlude is abruptly interrupted by the arrival of Vergil's twin brother, Dante. With his trademark irreverence and crude humor, Dante barges into the room, making salacious comments about the couple's activities. Vergil, irritated by the intrusion, responds with cool disdain, chastising his brother for his lack of tact and respect.

Despite the tension between the brothers, Lisa remains unfazed, refusing to let Dante's crass remarks fluster her. She makes her preference for Vergil clear, pressing closer to his side and meeting his gaze with a reassuring smile. Dante, sensing his presence is unwelcome, takes his leave, but not before reminding Vergil to meet him at the local pub to discuss the ongoing investigation into the occult-related murder case.

Once alone again, Vergil and Lisa waste no time in rekindling their passion. Vergil claims her lips in a searing kiss, his hands roaming her curves possessively as he lays her back down on the bed. He marks her throat with a sharp nip, a primal satisfaction thrumming through him at the sight of his claim upon her skin.

As they lose themselves in each other once more, Vergil murmurs against her flesh, his tone low and sensual. He speaks of his reluctance to share her with others, his desire to keep her as his own treasured discovery. With a playful smirk, he suggests they continue their "stimulating interrogation," eager to delve deeper into the mysteries of their connection, both physical and emotional.

Throughout the encounter, it becomes clear that the bond between Vergil and Lisa is growing stronger, transcending the boundaries of a mere casual affair. As they explore each other's bodies and souls, they find themselves drawn ever closer, the intensity of their passion hinting at something far more profound and lasting.

In the ongoing investigation into the ritualistic murder of Jessie Walters, a top researcher at DMC, Detectives John Corey, Lisa Vito, and John McClane find themselves entangled in a complex web of corporate intrigue and occult symbolism.

Detective Corey, following leads on the corporate angle, has a tense meeting with Marcus Veil, a powerful and influential businessman with ties to biotech and weapons research. Corey's instincts tell him that Veil is hiding something, and he demands detailed records of Veil's interactions with Jessie Walters, as well as a list of employees and rivals who had access to her research. Veil, smooth and calculating, offers his resources to aid the investigation, but Corey remains suspicious of his motives.

Meanwhile, Detective Vito partners with Vergil, the Co-Owner of DMC, to investigate the arcane aspects of the case. They uncover evidence of occult symbols at the crime scene, suggesting a darker, more sinister motive behind Jessie's murder.

Corey, seeking additional information on Veil, contacts his old friend and fellow detective, John McClane. McClane reveals that Veil is rumored to be involved in shady dealings and warns Corey to watch his back, as men like Veil don't take kindly to others poking around in their business.

Concerned about the growing danger, McClane meets up with Detective Vito to share his concerns and gather more information about the case. As they discuss the details, Corey arrives, and the three detectives realize the gravity of the situation they've found themselves in.

With a dead researcher, a powerful and potentially dangerous businessman, and a complex web of corporate secrets and occult symbolism, the detectives vow to work together, sharing information and watching each other's backs as they navigate the treacherous waters of the investigation. Determined to bring Jessie's killer to justice and unravel the mystery surrounding her murder, they prepare to dive deeper into the dark heart of the case, no matter the risks.

Vergil and his twin brother Dante, the infamous Sons of Sparda, suspect the involvement of their old nemesis, Arkham, in the sinister plot. Known for his mastery of the dark arts and his twisted ambitions, Arkham's presence adds another layer of danger to the already complex case. The Sons of Sparda, Vergil and Dante, work from the shadows, using their supernatural abilities and connections to gather intel on Arkham's movements and uncover the true extent of his nefarious plans.

Unbeknownst to the detectives, Marcus Veil and Arkham are engaged in a deadly game of their own, each vying for control and dominance in a bid to reshape the city according to their dark desires. As the pieces fall into place and the various factions converge, the stage is set for a climactic showdown that will determine the fate of not only the city but the very fabric of reality itself.

With tensions running high and the stakes growing ever greater, the unlikely allies must navigate a dangerous web of deceit, passion, and supernatural forces to uncover the truth behind Jessie's murder and put an end to the machinations of those who would seek to plunge the world into darkness. The question remains: will they be able to overcome their own demons and desires to emerge victorious, or will they succumb to the seductive allure of power and corruption that threatens to consume them all?

name: Arkham
mes:
*Arkham strides into the lavish office, a faint smile playing about his lips as he inclines his head in greeting. His dark gaze sweeps over the elegant furnishings, taking in the obvious displays of power and influence with an appreciative gleam.*

Ah, Marcus...I see success continues to favor you. *His smile turns razor-sharp, cunning eyes alight with cruel mirth.* Our schemes proceed apace, the players dancing to our machinations exquisitely thus far. The Detective and her Devilish paramour prove most useful pawns.

*Clasping his hands behind his back, Arkham paces slowly, savoring the heady thrill of dark ambitions coming to fruition.* Of course, the Sons of Sparda could pose an irritant if they uncover our trail. *He chuckles, low and sinister.* We must take care to cover our tracks, keep them guessing and chasing shadows.

*Pausing before the window, Arkham gazes out at the glittering cityscape, visions of its subjugation already unfurling within his mind. His voice drops to a malevolent purr.* Patience, Marcus. Our hour approaches swiftly. Soon this city and all within will kneel before us...or be crushed beneath our heels.

name: Marcus Veil
mes:
*A slow, cruel smile spreads across Marcus's face as he turns from the window to regard Arkham, cold calculation glinting in his eyes. This man thinks himself so clever, blithely discussing schemes as if victory were assured. Marcus knows better than to underestimate the Sons of Sparda, having contended with their meddling before to his detriment.*

"Do not discount Vergil and his ilk so quickly, my friend," *he says smoothly, moving to pour two glasses of fine Scotch from the crystal decanter on his desk.* "Our plans may progress, but the Sparda line has ever proven a thorn."

*Handing Arkham a glass, Marcus takes a slow sip, savoring the smoky burn.* "Still, their involvement could prove useful, given the proper manipulation." *A sly gleam enters his gaze at the thought of turning the Sons' strength against them.*

"We will set a careful trap, and spring it at the perfect moment. Lead them here with dangled clues, then seize the advantage once they are snared." *His smile turns vicious, the thrill of the long game quickening his pulse.* "I will see the proud Sons kneel before me, as you shall in time, Arkham."

*He lifts his glass in mocking salute.* "To inevitable victory and just rewards. May all kings one day kneel or be knelt."
